runners.name: For Pleasure
runners.comment: Remains on a tough mark and not certain to be suited by this step up in distance.
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful dual-purpose performer with seven hurdle wins, all at around 2m on varying ground and including one here; finished a respectable fifth of seven over 2m here last month, fading late; remains on a tough mark and not certain to be suited by this step up in distance.

quotes.race: Watch Racing Replays At racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: For Pleasure was going flat to the boards early on but he did relax after a couple of flights and I was able to give him a breather. He'd built up such a lead that he was not for catching. He's clearly got an engine and Alex [Hales] has his horses in great form - Harry Bannister, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's contested two good-quality novice chases around Warwick and near enough ran to his mark when third last week. We may have to pick and choose our races as he likes to dominate and has to go left-handed. We'll probably keep him in the Fighting Fifth Hurdle on Monday and see if it cuts up, while there is a novice chase at Plumpton on December 13 that could suit. He owes us nothing after a great last season. 22-11-21

He is a bonny horse who has won seven times and he's still only six! He fell on his first chase start of the season at Warwick, but his second run when third to Edwardstone at the same track last month was much better, which was a fair effort considering the winner franked the form at Grade 1 level next time out. He dropped in class last time at Plumpton and was electric over his fences, coming home 37 lengths clear of Nassalam. Even if the favourite was a little off his best, it was still a terrific performance. I suspect he will head to Doncaster next for the Grade 2 Lightning Novices' Chase at the end of next month. His success at Plumpton provides him with the opportunity of a £50,000 bonus if he is successful at the festival and his owner is naturally keen to go there, but I would lean a little more towards Aintree. He'll have as light a campaign as possible in case we take in both of those races. 30-12-21

runners.name: Watergrange Jack
runners.comment: Worth considering now reverting to hurdles back on a winnable mark for his in-form stable.
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over hurdles, all at around this distance on good ground; gained a first chase win in September but has not had things go to plan since and was last seen pulling up at Kelso in October; has gone well back from a break in the past and he's worth considering now back on a winnable mark for his in-form stable.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a brave performance. Watergrange Jack ran away with me at Uttoxeter a couple of starts back, so I always knew it was going to be very tactical. I wanted to get him switched off early but you don't want to leave Jamie Moore in front for too long as he's a very good judge of pace. I thought when we got to the top of the hill that it's almost a free bit of energy to use when you can roll down there and be aggressive out of the bend, and thankfully it's worked. I had to go when I did because he only got up late over a longer trip here last time. It's a long way to be racing but he's a brave horse and thankfully he's got plenty of guts about him too - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: KilbegganRaces.com (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Watergrange Jack has been fierce consistent. In Killarney he was a bit unlucky as he got hampered by the faller and I thought he should have won that day. He had a cracking run in Galway and deserved this. Patrick gave him a great ride. Niall Redmond and Mikey McGuane did great jobs on him as well but Niall got injured, so couldn't ride him, and Mikey hadn't his licence sorted out in time. I was lucky to get Patrick. He'll probably go for a hurdle, get a little bit of a break and then come back after Christmas - Patrick Hayes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a consistent horse. He's had a good season with eight runs and three wins. He's solid but the ground just went against him at Exeter last time. That was over fences and he'll probably run over fences now until the autumn. He looks like more of a chaser than a hurdler to me. He should have a competitive season and he should be at his best now. 06-03-24

runners.name: Pearly Island
runners.comment: C&D winner in January but not so good since; back down 2lb but needs to bounce back.
runners.spotlight: Made a successful return to hurdles over C&D in a newly fitted visor in January but nowhere near that level in two runs since, tailed-off last of 12 in refitted cheekpieces at Warwick latest; down 2lb and visor returns; capable of getting involved if bouncing back.

quotes.race: Gamble Plant Norfolk Ltd Grand Prix Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: After Pearly Island ran over fences at Doncaster last time I suggested a try back over hurdles. It's nice to get it right sometimes - Tom Cannon, jockey.

quotes.race: Boost Your Festival Winnings @rhino.bet Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was a drop in class for Pearly Island and we came here quite confident as the race he finished second in at Fakenham has worked out well. The ground was soft enough for him and we'll keep going after that - Lucy Wadham, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was a lovely win for his owner when he switched back to hurdles from chasing at Fakenham on New Year's Day. He's been a pretty solid horse but has been quite disappointing on his last two runs. He has a problem with his feet - they're very flat - and he recently pulled both his front plates off, which wasn't ideal. We're going to take him back to Fakenham on April 1 next. 19-03-25

runners.name: Ip Up
runners.comment: Difficult to rule out now back up in trip after a better effort here last time.
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner, including here, but she struggles with consistency; came back to some form when a close third over 2m here last month and difficult to rule out if repeating the effort with the step back up in distance likely to suit.

quotes.race: Greene King Flint Eye Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Mares' Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Ip Up is a nice addition to the team and the plan was to drop her in but she jumped very well and had a few of them in trouble - Craig Nichol, rider.

runners.name: Busy Being Busy
runners.comment: Unexposed 5yo who now takes a step up in grade off a 6lb rise for his recent C&D success.
runners.spotlight: Came good at the fifth attempt over hurdles when a comfortable winner of a Class 5 over C&D 18 days ago, on third start for this stable; unexposed 5yo who takes a step up in grade off a 6lb rise and can improve again.

quotes.race: Volt Low Alcohol Ipa @ Fakenham Racecourse Handicap Hurdle (For The Walter Wales Cup)
quotes.quote: Busy Being Busy has been very tricky at home as he's very keen, but it worked out well today. I think the fierce pace around this track helped him - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

runners.name: Toonagh Warrior
runners.comment: Solid effort when finishing second to Jongleur d'Etoiles at Wincanton last month; player.
runners.spotlight: Twice a runner-up late last year and came back to some form after some lesser efforts when just over a 3l second to Jongleur d'Etoiles at Wincanton (3m, good to soft) last month; remains competitively treated if backing that up.

runners.name: Wa Wa
runners.comment: Big player off an unchanged mark now back up in trip after his promising stable debut.
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 10yo who has won twice over hurdles and fences (2m4f-3m); found some of his old spark on first start for Olly Murphy last month when finishing runner-up at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft); likely to be in the mix again off an unchanged mark with the step back up in trip also looking a positive.

quotes.race: Cavan Developments Home Builders Supporting St. Mary's GAA Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Wa Wa stays well, the further he went the better. He liked the ground and kept going, he will go further going forward and is going the right way - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer

runners.name: For Gina
runners.owner: Louise Kemble And J J W Wadham
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner but yet to match that level this season; place claims if bouncing back.
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner on slow ground (acts on good); struggling for form this season and showed no improvement for the return to this venue last time when finishing a well-held fourth of seven over this distance; remains 6lb above her most recent win last February.

quotes.race: Payne Crop Nutrition Ltd Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: For Gina was great. I'd never ridden her before but I spoke to Tom [Cannon, jockey] and he filled me full of confidence that she was straightforward and not to complicate things. I wished someone had taken me into the race a bit more as the race fell apart after three out but she's done it nicely - Alex Chadwick, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Greene King Level Head Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: There were a few in the field with big weights, which is difficult around here, and For Gina was very game and just outbattled them. She's as hard as nails and she made it easy for me - Bryony Frost, jockey.

runners.name: Star Legend
runners.comment: Flat winner last week; equally as effective over hurdles and worth considering.
runners.spotlight: Capable dual-purpose performer who got a belated first win on the Flat when a narrow winner at Chelmsford (1m6f) five days ago; equally as effective in this sphere and a C&D winner in December off 3lb lower; quick turnaround to defy but he shouldn't be far away.

stable_tour.quote: He was quite a shock winner at Fakenham last time but he'd just dropped into a lower grade. He does really well around Fakenham, which is really nice as it's a track I love supporting. We've just set up a syndicate to sell him to more local people, which will mean he'll keep running at local tracks like Fakenham and Huntingdon. 01-01-25

runners.name: Jongleur Detoiles
runners.comment: Up another 6lb on good going he's yet to prove a liking for but remains open to progress.
runners.spotlight: Improving 6yo, winning three of his last four starts, only blip coming when a below-par third at Southwell on his penultimate start before resuming progress at Wincanton (3m, good to soft) when beating Toonagh Warrior in this grade last month; up another 6lb and has yet to prove his liking for good ground but he remains open to progress.

3:10.race_name: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Mares' Handicap Chase (Queen Boudicca Mares' Chase Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Loud And Proud
runners.comment: Ready winner at Doncaster (3m2f, good) 18 days ago; 9lb higher but still the one to beat.
runners.spotlight: Always to the fore and readily off the mark at Doncaster (3m2f, good) 18 days ago; now 9lb higher, but is worthy of such a rise given the level of improvement that she's shown switched to fences; likely to take plenty of pegging back around here; rates as the one to beat.

runners.name: Rock On Rita
runners.comment: Back to form, justifying market support, when scoring over 2m5f here recently; 7lb higher.
runners.spotlight: Back to form, justifying market support, when scoring over 2m5f here (good to soft) recently; 7lb higher, but the drying ground conditions should suit; did manage to win a point over 3m in November 2020, but has been mostly campaigned over shorter; stablemate of Jamaicaine.

runners.name: Jamaicaine
runners.comment: Some promise over hurdles; chase debut off a 328-day absence; stablemate of Rock On Rita.
runners.spotlight: Modest in her first four hurdle starts but was faring better when hampered by a loose horse and unseating her rider at the second-last at Fontwell (2m3f, good) last May; off since and switches to fences for the first time with stamina to prove over 3m; stablemate of Rock On Rita.

runners.name: Ballygelly
runners.breeder: C A F R E Enniskellen Campus
runners.comment: Pulled up on return from wind surgery at Taunton (2m2f, soft) in February; unappealing.
runners.spotlight: Point winner (3m, soft to heavy) who has achieved little under rules; pulled up on return from wind surgery at Taunton (2m2f, soft; 22-1, second run over fences) in February; headgear tweaked once more as she seeks to rediscover a basic spark; unappealing.

2:10.race_name: Racing TV Mares' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: My Dream
runners.comment: Has only displayed a modest level of ability and needs to improve for the longer trip.
runners.spotlight: Has only shown a modest level of ability in two bumpers and in four attempts over hurdles, most recently when pulled up on handicap debut at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft); needs to improve for the longer trip.

runners.name: Summerleaze
runners.comment: Looks to have been found a good opportunity to follow up last month's Stratford win.
runners.spotlight: Justified support when making a winning debut for Olly Murphy at Stratford (2m6f, good to soft), finding plenty when asked to go and win her race; also effective on good ground; looks to have been found an inviting opportunity to follow up off 5lb higher.

runners.name: Troubleisontheway
runners.comment: Has shown little so far but she could be suited by this step up in trip on handicap debut.
runners.spotlight: Has finished tailed off on all three runs over hurdles, most recently at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) in December; however, her pedigree suggests she could improve for this step up in distance and this isn't a strong race; handicap debut.

runners.name: Regally Blonde
runners.owner: Case Racing Partnership & Anita J Lush
runners.comment: Continues to fall in the weights but goes back up in trip with plenty to prove.
runners.spotlight: 1m5f Flat winner in 2022 but yet to win over hurdles (2m-3m1f) after 13 attempts (pulled up on sole chase start) and hasn't shown any immediate benefit for wind surgery in two runs since; continues to fall in the weights but goes back up in trip with a bit to prove.

runners.name: Varinia
runners.breeder: Mrs Larissa Kneip & Mrs Sandrine Grevet
runners.comment: Makes handicap debut with cheekpieces now tried and the longer trip likely to suit.
runners.spotlight: Won a good-ground point bumper last May but has offered little in three runs over hurdles (2m-2m5f), latest at Hereford (2m4f, good to soft) when beaten 63l; cheekpieces now go on and she makes her handicap debut in a weak race with the longer trip likely to suit.

runners.name: Voleur De Terres
runners.comment: More needed on handicap debut but she's on a low mark with the step up to 3m a plus.
runners.spotlight: 2-11 in Irish points (wins on soft to heavy) but beaten by wide margins in all three starts over hurdles, all over 2m and latest at Uttoxeter (soft) in February; more likely needed now switching to handicaps but she's on a basement mark with the step up to nearly 3m looking a positive.

2:40.race_name: Racing TV On Sky 424 Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Kelijoe
runners.comment: French AQPS winner in November who has been found a weak race for his British debut.
runners.spotlight: A £42,000 purchase in January after winning his third start in AQPS in France (1m4f), all on very soft/heavy; unproven on ground as quick as this and it's hard to gauge the level of his ability but he's of obvious appeal having been found a very weak race for his British/stable debut with Sean Bowen in the saddle.

runners.name: My Mate Mike
runners.comment: Well held on last month's hurdle debut and remains with stamina to prove.
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner, all at 7f; 150-1 when well held on hurdle debut at Huntingdon (2m, good) 20 days ago, made mistakes; entitled to improve on that but remains with stamina to prove.

runners.name: One Million Dreams

prev_owners.owner: Paul Deavin, Gerald Chesneau Et Al

runners.comment: Only a modest level of form so far over hurdles but he's worth considering in a weak race.
runners.spotlight: Shaped promisingly on debut in a French Flat contest in February last year but has yet to build on that in five starts over hurdles since, latterly in Britain; faded late but didn't run badly back on the Flat at Southwell last month and he has to enter calculations in a weak race back in this code.

runners.name: Peerless Percy
runners.comment: Comes back in trip but he's finished tailed off in both starts over hurdles.
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner; back from an absence when tailed off on hurdle debut in February and fared little better at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft) last month; comes back in trip.

runners.name: Dartmouth Rose
runners.comment: Well held in both starts over hurdles, most recently on stable debut in February.
runners.spotlight: Failed to progress for Pam Sly after a promising third on her second start in bumpers and has offered little in both runs over hurdles, most recently on stable debut in February.

runners.name: Abbey Law
runners.comment: Modest on the Flat and was beaten 43l on last month's hurdle/stable debut.
runners.spotlight: Dam was a fair 2m-2m4f hurdle winner but this filly showed only a modest level of form in both starts on the Flat (1m) for Amy Murphy and was beaten 43l on last month's hurdle debut for her new stable.

4:55.race_name: Turner Trophy 'Grassroots' Maiden Hunters' Chase (For The Turner Trophy)

runners.name: Bride Rovers Abu
runners.comment: Won two points, the latest of which was for K. Morgan at Alnwick (3m, gd/sft) in December.
runners.spotlight: Won two points, the latest of which was for this trainer at Alnwick (3m, good to soft; 2-1 joint-favourite) in December; set to make rules debut just over three weeks after finishing third of four (beaten 10l) in an Intermediate at Guilsborough.

runners.name: Get Bye
runners.comment: Third in a novice hunter at Stratford (2m5f; 100-1, beaten 25l) 22 days ago; vulnerable.
runners.spotlight: Point winner (3m maiden, good; made all) in February 2023; runner-up four times since, also making the frame in a novice hunter at Stratford (2m5f, good to soft; 100-1, beaten 25l) 22 days ago; vulnerable to one or two of his younger rivals.

runners.name: Good Source
runners.comment: Runner-up in a point here last week; is likely to have a positive role to play.
runners.spotlight: 3-18 in points, his most recent win coming in a Members event at Higham (3m, good) last March; slow to get going this season but on the way back now, only headed after the last in a 3m point here (good; second, 5-2) last week; likely to have a positive role to play.

runners.name: Jersey Fromentin

prev_owners.owner: David Everard, Adele Hardy & Ruth Pennoc

runners.comment: Won three-runner point at Ampton (3m, with Good Source behind) last month; noteworthy.
runners.spotlight: Successful in two of his last three points, winning here (3m, good) last April and, more recently, in a three-runner affair at Ampton (3m, good; with today's rival Good Source a beaten odds-on favourite); time to see what he's capable of now switched to rules for the first time.

runners.name: Red Delta
runners.comment: 3-9 in points, winning at Charm Park latest (3m, good; Mens Open); has to be of interest.
runners.spotlight: 3-9 in points, winning at Charm Park latest (3m, good; Mens Open) for the second year in succession; pulled up at Leicester on sole start under rules but this is much easier, so this stablemate of the 2024 Cheltenham Festival Hunter Chase winner Sine Nomine has to be of significant interest.

runners.name: Kostantina
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Pulled up here (3m point; 14-1) last week; sole win came back in April 2022; least likely
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in three of her last eight starts, including when always behind in a 3m point here (good; 14-1) last week; sole win came back in April 2022 when making all in a mares' maiden at Dingley (2m4f, good); the least likely in this field.

runners.name: Flegmatik
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake

runners.comment: Three-time course winner; went close over 2m4f here last month and 3m also suits
runners.spotlight: Three-time course winner (2m4f-3m); not quite at best this season but handicapped according, and went down fighting when a clear second here (2m4f, good) last month; likely contender.

quotes.race: New Bet-In-Race With Coral Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Flegmatik was brilliant and just tanked round with me. I think he enjoyed taking the mickey out of me and did it well - Tristran Durrell, jockey.

quotes.race: Coral Trophy Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: What can you say? We had a plan to pull that off all season. It was a terrible run at Sandown, I don't know why and that knocked our enthusiasm a bit for today. Flegmatik has run a great race. He clearly loves it around here but it is gutting to get beat. Fair play to the winner, he was off the bridle halfway down the back straight, but he has kept on - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral 'Fail-To-Finish' Free Bets Handicap Chase (Challenger Middle Distance Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: There was a little bit of a question mark stepping back in trip, not necessarily in terms of ability, I just wondered whether there would be one following us round and outsprinting us from the last. Flegmatik is getting the hang of it. He's always been a nice horse but he's taken a lot of time. I'm going to completely leave him until the bet365 Gold Cup as I've always had it in my mind that one day he'll be an extreme stayer because of the way he jumps and travels in the early part of his races - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV In Stunning HD Juvenile Hurdle
quotes.quote: Flegmatik is a lovely horse. We have our eye on him as a chaser so we won't go wild with him this season - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran okay at Ascot last time but the handicapper's got him way too high. He's good right-handed and he'll be a force again when he's off the right rating. 12-11-24

runners.name: Hermino Aa
runners.owner: Galloping On The South Downs Partnership
runners.comment: Good hurdle winner in the autumn but failed to complete both previous chases (in 2023)
runners.spotlight: In career-best form when scoring over hurdles at Newbury (3m, soft) on seasonal debut in November and both subsequent runs were very respectable; however, he failed to complete his two chases in 2023 and would probably prefer ground slower than good.

stable_tour.quote: He's a fair horse. It didn't work out for him over fences at the start of last season, so we reverted to hurdles and he ran some good races, including when second in a premier handicap at Sandown in February. He's capable of running in good staying handicap hurdles if he doesn't go over fences again. 29-10-24

runners.name: Menaggio
runners.comment: 2-4 over fences this season; still has low mileage; moves up to 3m for first time today
runners.spotlight: Launched chasing career with two small-field wins at Plumpton (2m3f, good) in the autumn and rebounded from a poor run (bled from the nose) when second of five at Kelso (2m5f, good to soft) last month; still has low mileage and could have untapped potential over 3m.

quotes.race: Nick Embiricos Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I think Menaggio was very good. He was a bit long at the first ditch but on the whole I was delighted with his jumping and he saw it out well. I hadn't really looked beyond this race. We just wanted to get him started. We'll sit down and have a think but he's a nice prospect and he'll get further. I think he'd get three [miles] but we're not in a rush to get there. That was a sharp as he wants there. Hopefully, he's progressing - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He only won once over hurdles last season but his final second at Kempton was a good effort, probably his best run. He made a winning chase debut over 2m3½f at Plumpton on Monday, jumping really well and staying on powerfully. I hope he'll continue to progress, particularly over slightly further. 25-10-24

He was the first of my exciting team of novice chasers to win over fences and he did the job well at Plumpton, jumping soundly and staying on powerfully. He'd shown decent form as a hurdler and should continue to progress, particularly over slightly further than 2m4f. 07-11-24

runners.name: Young Buster
runners.comment: Lightly raced 9yo; will find this easier than latest task and has slipped to a good mark
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 9yo; unable to land a telling blow in major handicap at Doncaster (3m, good) on latest outing in January but drops in grade here and is now 3lb lower than when second at Aintree (3m1f, good) last spring.

quotes.race: Children's Immunology Trust Supporting CHAS Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's important at this stage of his career to get a bit of confidence into him and not overface him. Young Buster has won three of his last four now, so we'll maybe try and make that four out of five and find something similar. The ground went heavy and that was massive today. I think two more furlongs on that ground might just have found him out, so it worked out well - Paddy Brennan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Ideal Des Bordes
runners.breeder: E A R L Les Bordes De Mornay Et Al
runners.owner: Mrs C Hanbury & Mrs H Mackenzie Smith
runners.comment: Ran as though something was amiss last time but earlier form makes him a big player
runners.spotlight: Ran as though something was amiss here on latest outing in February (had wind op soon afterwards) but made bright start to his chasing career beforehand, winning at Wincanton (3m1f, good to soft) before clear second behind progressive rival over C&D (good to soft); also suited by good ground; major player if back on song.

quotes.race: Family Fun Day Sunday 13th April Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's taken us this long to get Ideal Des Bordes out, which is boring because we've chewed up half the season, but he's a nice horse. He's a proper staying chaser - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a point-to-point winner who got off the mark for us at the fifth attempt in a novice hurdle at Kempton in May. He might not be as high on everyone's radar as some, but I think he could be progressive going three miles over fences. He could be an exciting project and he's certainly an individual who could go a very long way in that sphere. 22-10-24

runners.name: Lord Of Cheshire
runners.comment: Won on chasing debut in October and might still have more to offer over fences
runners.spotlight: Beat three rivals to make winning seasonal/chase debut at Fontwell (2m3f, good to soft) in October and ran well until penultimate-fence fall on latest outing in December; effective on good ground and might still have more to offer over fences; respected.

quotes.race: Get Daily Tips At racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought I wasn't doing Lord Of Cheshire any justice as I got the last two down the back very wrong. It took him off the bridle so instead of going for him I tried to niggle him back into it. He's a Diamond Boy, a good staying horse so I thought he could keep going and he was really professional at the end - Finn Lambert, jockey.

quotes.race: Mike & Belinda Birthday Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lord Of Cheshire ran a nice race here before and that was lovely. He's a nice horse and he'll keep improving. I imagine he'll be a chaser in the future but we'll go into handicaps now - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

runners.name: Kart Destruval
runners.comment: Won heavy-ground hurdle in France last spring; pulled up in handicap hurdle last month
runners.spotlight: Very unexposed 5yo who won a heavy-ground hurdle in France last spring; pulled up on last month's handicap hurdle debut (respiratory noise reported) and remains a tricky horse to weigh up but Dan Skelton is evidently very keen to switch him to fences; hooded for first time.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse who won over hurdles in France. He made a terrible noise on his first run for us at Wetherby, so we've had his wind looked at and we'll be hoping he can fulfil the promise he's shown in his work at home. 12-11-24

runners.name: Demoiselle Kap
runners.breeder: E A R L De Cordelles Et Al
runners.comment: Won first four races for new stable this year and ran well in defeat on latest outing
runners.spotlight: Started off for Jennie Candlish with four wins in February/March (two hurdles, two chases) and was not discredited when second over fences at Ludlow (2m, good) 12 days ago; might still be on the upgrade and needs to be taken very seriously.

quotes.race: Coming Soon betvickers.com Sports Betting Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Demoiselle Kap was pretty good on the whole even though the ground may have been a bit quick for her - Luke Scott, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Arabian Horse Bahrain Equine Products UK Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Demoiselle Kap jumped a lot better than I thought she would. She was very good at the ditch down the back then at the last down the back she came out of my hands and I knew she had loads left. We'll have to go up in grade now so we'll find out a lot more - Sean Quinlan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Everyonesgame
runners.comment: Safely held when last of three on chasing debut in November; back from a break today
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on old hurdling form but yet to hit top gear after four runs for new stable this season; safely held when last of three on chasing debut at Plumpton (2m3f, good) in November and returns from latest break with fair bit to prove.

quotes.race: Cazoo "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's amazing what a wind operation can do. It was probably a little bit soft for  Everyonesgame today but we always thought he was nice. He's a proper decent ground horse and he'll run through some of the summer, hopefully in some nicer races. He's unexposed - Charlie Longsdon, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: Although he has not set the world alight this season, he did win his bumper last term at Doncaster and looked a lovely young prospect. He has not lived up to expectations this autumn, but we felt an operation on his breathing could help, which he has now had. He is a fine, big, strapping horse by Jet Away, and I have always thought he would be okay. He was fifth last time at Newbury in a decent novice hurdle and, having travelled well throughout, he made a bad mistake late on which scuppered hopes. He has been given a mark of 115 and I think he could be potentially very well handicapped come the spring. 11-01-23

runners.name: El Rojo Grande
runners.comment: Placed at Taunton two starts ago but effectively 21lb higher from out of the weights here
runners.spotlight: 0-8 under rules; returned from long absence with fair third off lowly mark at Taunton (2m2f, soft) in February, despite tending to jump left, but is effectively 21lb higher from out of the weights here.

4:30.race_name: Download The Racing TV App Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Hidalgo De Lisle
runners.comment: Better known as a chaser now but current hurdle mark is workable; can't be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Better known as a chaser now and was below form when last in action six weeks ago but reverts to hurdling on a workable mark and will be suited by today's trip-and-ground combination.

runners.name: Royal Way
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Camp Benard
runners.comment: Developed into useful juvenile last season but has become disappointing this term
runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick when winning quite valuable juvenile handicap at Ascot (1m7f, good) just over a year ago but has become disappointing this season and arrives here after two heavy defeats; will appreciate today's ease in grade but still needs a significant boost from the new blinkers.

quotes.race: Events At Ascot Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I bought Royal Way for the Triumph Hurdle but we knew after one run he wasn't a Triumph horse. We then said we'll go for the Boodles and he missed out by one, but what a consolation this is - Keith Loads, owner.

quotes.race: Vobe Electrics Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Royal Way is the most expensive horse I've bought, I got him privately with a dream for the Triumph Hurdle. That dream was stopped after his first run and then we bumped into one last time but he's settling better and Niall said there's a lot left in the tank. I could take a Fred Winter with him. Gary (Moore, trainer) said we could look at the top tables on the Flat too so there's plenty to look forward to - Keith Loads, owner.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he'd win the Fred Winter last season but he got balloted out by one and two weeks later won a good prize at Ascot. He's a good little horse and ran a nice race at Cheltenham on Saturday. He was a bit gassy and will improve for the run. A big field, where there's some pace on and we can settle him in behind, would be ideal but he finished his race well at Cheltenham. It'll be the Gerry Feilden at the Coral Gold Cup meeting or the Greatwood Hurdle back at Cheltenham in November next. He could do with ground on the softer side and I expect him to have a good season in handicap hurdles. 29-10-24

runners.name: Prolific Profile
runners.comment: Won three in a row in September/October; off since November but further progress possible
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with three 2m wins in September/October (good/good to soft); absent since tame finishing effort at Doncaster in November but further progress remains possible if he's fully tuned up.

runners.name: Thank You Blue
runners.comment: Ridden clear to cause 20-1 surprise when back over hurdles last month; drops back in trip
runners.spotlight: Has poor completion record over fences this season but was ridden clear to cause 20-1 surprise when back over hurdles at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) a fortnight ago; not sure to be ideally suited by today's drop back to 2m but the faster ground won't be a problem and a recent 6lb rise ought to be manageable.

quotes.race: JTC Pizzalicious Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Thank You Blue jumped really well. He'll probably be better over a little bit further, I was just forcing him for the last half a mile. He was good over the last two and galloped to the line - Sean Quinlan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: We managed to get this lovely big rangy horse out for one run last term in a Wincanton bumper, where he ran a smashing race in what looked like a very hot contest. That was over 1m7f, but he has plenty of stamina and we will try and get another bumper into him next, although he is still around six or seven weeks off his return. I look on him as a medium-term project as you will not really see him at his best until he is seven or eight years old. 09-11-22

runners.name: Lions Peak
runners.breeder: Belmont B/S, Glenville B/S & Conor Ryan
runners.comment: Won Hereford maiden by 8l last month; could easily have more to offer in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on hurdling debut in December but has fared much better on both starts for new stable this year, more recently when winning Hereford maiden (2m3f, good) by 8l last month; drops back in trip for handicap debut; could easily have more to offer.

runners.name: Whispering Royal
runners.comment: Well beaten on recent stable debut and has a lot more to prove than some of these
runners.spotlight: Won maiden hurdle for Alan King at end of 2023 and was placed twice on the Flat last year but, following a layoff, was tailed off in recent handicap hurdle for new stable; needs to have taken considerable benefit from that outing.

quotes.race: bet365 Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Whispering Royal got an easy lead and put his experience from Wincanton to good use. I'm not sure how much depth there was to the race, we'll find out in a few weeks' time, but he didn't do anything wrong - Tom Cannon, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been running with promise on the Flat and I was keen to get him started over hurdles earlier this month at Chepstow until all the rain came. Soft ground will be fine but I didn't want to start him on heavy. He's a straightforward horse and we should have a lot of fun with him. He may make his hurdling debut at Wincanton on Sunday. 25-10-23
I hope we'll have some fun with him over hurdles as he's shown promise on the Flat, and he started by finishing third at Wincanton last month. That experience will bring him on plenty. 10-11-23

2:22.race_name: Join Racing TV Now 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Go West
runners.comment: Ran to useful level when comfortably making all at Fakenham and Taunton in the winter
runners.spotlight: Ran to useful level when making all to win comfortably at Fakenham (2m4f, good to soft) and Taunton (2m3f, soft) during the winter; may not be ideally suited by the faster ground here but still commands respect.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Super Week, Supersized Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Go West was entitled to be a bit fresh last time but he travelled well, jumped great and never really saw a rival all the way round. He's a nice horse and he'll keep improving. It's a good bit of placing by the boss to send him here - Harry Cobden, jockey.

quotes.race: Salisbury Hospice Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Category 3 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Go West isn't really a bumper horse, but I didn't want to go novice hurdling this season. We could give him another run but he'll be hurdling in the autumn and the rain was ideal for him because it put a bit of emphasis on stamina. He'll be going over a trip when he's hurdling - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Runner-up on his only start in an Irish maiden point-to-point at Nenagh in March, he'll have one bumper run and then we'll decide whether to stick to bumpers or go novice hurdling. Should be ready in a week or two. 31-10-22

runners.name: Old Cowboy
runners.comment: Won easily by 20l at Plumpton last month and has since run well in a handicap
runners.spotlight: Delivered on earlier promise when winning easily by 20l at Plumpton (2m4f, good) last month, his fourth hurdling start, and backed up that performance with creditable third in recent Newbury handicap (2m3f, good); obvious contender.

quotes.race: Thank You Plumpton Members "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Old Cowboy is a very good, natural jumper and we kept it simple. We wanted to take a lead off Willie [Mullins]'s horse but he jumped so well that we skipped around here. The yard's form has turned a corner and he loved that better ground too - Niall Houlihan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He's worked well and schooled well and he'll probably start around Christmas over hurdles. From what we've seen, we like him a lot. 29-10-24

runners.name: Peace Of Rome
runners.comment: Has some fair hurdling form on his CV but is not favoured by the weights here
runners.spotlight: Showed some fair hurdling form in 2022-23 and returned from long absence with a reasonably encouraging run at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft) last month but has quite a bit to find with his two rivals here.

stable_tour.quote: He shaped encouragingly on his debut at Kempton before going close in a Warwick bumper. His schooling has been good and he should have a productive campaign as a novice hurdler. 24-10-22

2:52.race_name: Racing TV In HD Every Day Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Kally Des Bruyeres
runners.breeder: Florence Thomas De Gigou & Tangi Saliou
runners.comment: Shock maiden winner in November but has struggled in both handicaps since
runners.spotlight: Caused 200-1 shock in Huntingdon maiden (2m, good) in November, his third hurdling start, but struggled in both subsequent handicaps and is only 3lb lower today.

quotes.race: Follow Us On X @betrhino Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We rated Kally Des Bruyeres very highly last year as one of our nicest young horses. He's clearly benefited from a wind op, and the better ground probably helped him - David Dennis, trainer.

runners.name: Gregorians Star
runners.comment: Showed only minor promise in his qualifying races; improvement needed on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won a good-ground bumper in the autumn but has shown only minor promise on his three hurdling starts this year and almost certainly needs to improve to overcome his opening handicap mark.

runners.name: Dreams Fled Away
runners.comment: Second on handicap debut in October but two disappointing runs followed; back from break
runners.spotlight: Runner-up off today's mark on handicap hurdle debut at Fakenham (2m, good) in October but two disappointing efforts followed and it's hard to know what to expect from him on this first start for three months.

runners.name: Graham
runners.comment: Behind Character Testing when third last month but Flat form offers hope he can do better
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful Flat racer for Richard Hannon; made quiet start to hurdling career for new stable this year and was about 5l behind Character Testing on last month's handicap debut at Plumpton (2m, good) but may still have a bigger run in him in this sphere.

runners.name: Character Testing
runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles but went close at Plumpton last month and ought to remain competitive
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles but went down fighting when close second at Plumpton (2m, good) three weeks ago and ought to remain very competitive after recent 2lb nudge.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Character Testing has bumped into a few nice horses and it's great to get his nose in front. He'd been doing absolutely nothing wrong in defeat. We wanted to get the ball rolling on the all-weather, so it's great to get on the board as quickly as we could. You're back to zero on the first of January and we want to kick on for hopefully another good year - Tom Clover, trainer.

runners.name: Fine Point
runners.comment: Shaped well before fading into sixth on last month's handicap debut; could have a say
runners.spotlight: Placed on good ground against own age-group in the autumn and shaped pretty well before fading in sixth on last month's handicap debut at Doncaster (2m, good to soft; several flights omitted); could have a say.

runners.name: Kingly Fighter
runners.comment: Well beaten on all three hurdling starts and needs to take a big step forward
runners.spotlight: Well beaten all three starts, most recently when 200-1 for Huntingdon maiden (2m, good; first run after wind surgery) last month; makes handicap debut from a lowly mark but needs to take a big step forward.

runners.name: Ramaah
runners.comment: Low-grade Flat winner last summer; yet to pose a threat after four hurdle runs
runners.spotlight: Won low-grade AW handicap (1m5f; RPR 62) for Ismail Mohammed last summer but has not shown a great deal on his four hurdling starts for Sarah-Jayne Davies; sports refitted cheekpieces for handicap debut.

runners.name: I Love Paris
runners.comment: Made inauspicious start to hurdling career but latest run was more encouraging
runners.spotlight: Fair on the Flat for Ed Walker last year; made inauspicious start to hurdling career in the autumn (failed to complete consecutive races) but his run at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) in February was more encouraging and further progress is possible in handicaps.

stable_tour.quote: She showed good form in maidens last year and will stay further than a mile. I think she's on a very fair mark. 25-04-24

runners.name: Simply Gorgeous
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with a poor run but made the frame in her first two handicaps; a possible
runners.spotlight: Absent since ending 2024 with a disappointing run but made the frame in her first two handicaps, more notably when second at Lingfield (2m, good) in November; contender if back on song after her break.

runners.name: Charles Morin

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Flat winner; needs improvement over hurdles but this switch to good ground should help
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in three juvenile/maiden hurdles on good to soft ground in the autumn then struggled to cope with heavy on handicap debut in January; needs to improve but was a Flat winner on good ground last spring and now gets to run on a sound surface for the first time in this sphere.

5:05.race_name: Nick Luck Daily Podcast "Pointing Pointers" Open Hunters' Chase

runners.name: Captain Tommy
runners.comment: In-form 11yo who won two hunter chases last month; must be considered
runners.spotlight: In-form 11yo who returned to racing under rules with hunter chase wins at Catterick (3m1f, good) and Ludlow (2m4f, good) last month; has 8lb penalty to shoulder here but must be considered in current mood.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Staffordshire Plate Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a wonderful prize to win and being out of the handicap didn't make a difference. Captain Tommy was fit when we got him and the change of scenery has worked for him - David Bridgewater, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The Star Sports App Now! Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Captain Tommy wants good ground; it was not his ground at Fontwell last time. He's got a great attitude and will stay further. He'll probably stay in through the summer and I don't know how good he's going to be, but maybe he might be good enough for some of those nice races at Market Rasen - Harry Whittington, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He produced a good performance when second on his penultimate start at Bangor. He missed the last and I like the winner, Manofthemountain, a lot. He just hated the quick ground at Wincanton on Thursday, but I'm sure he'll bounce back on softer ground next time. He's economical over his fences. 09-11-20

runners.name: Janika

prev_owners.owner: Simon Munir, Isaac Souede & Guy Cherel

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

quotes.race: Coral Haldon Gold Cup (A Limited Handicap Chase) (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: The drop in trip was a bit of a question mark as Janika had been running over 2m5f and 2m4f but he has done his job well. He is quite a small horse but he makes up for that with a big heart. He is six years old so there are plenty of opportunities coming up over the rest of the season for him - Daryl Jacob, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't show much last season until the Topham, when he seemed to be rejuvenated by the National fences. He's quite forward and will be ready to go when the ground eases. 24-10-22

runners.name: Before Midnight

prev_owners.owner: Walters Plant Hire & James & Jean Potter

runners.comment: Very useful in his prime but out of form when last seen last summer; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Will be suited by today's good ground and was a very useful handicap chaser in his prime but was out of form for Fergal O'Brien when last seen last summer and it's hard to gauge how much ability he retains as a 12yo.

quotes.race: Gerard Bertrand Hurst Park Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fair play to the second, who gave us a good battle, but it shows how genuine Before Midnight is. He did it nicely at Cheltenham and was up 8lb today and had to get stuck in. I think we'll stick to two miles and he didn't show his true colours today. I don't know why. I could probably go out there and say the ground is this or that, but he never jumped like he can. We'll think about the Grand Annual, but we'll probably get a hike and he doesn't owe us anything. He's a good-ground horse - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: 888Sport Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The way Before Midnight jumps is part of why we stepped him back to two miles. It paid off at Chepstow and we felt we had a little bit up our sleeves. This has been the target since May time and it's great to pull it off - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Before Midnight will take a bit more time. He went through the race nicely but when I asked him to put the race to bed he was waiting for a bit. He was holding them, but he was a bit unsure and he'll progress in time. He wants further, but there's no rush. He does everything nicely and has the makings of a nice horse - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Budweiser Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Before Midnight is a horse we like. He handled that ground fine and quickened up well - Nico de Boinville, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a superstar all season and won really well at Cheltenham in October. He also ran an absolute stormer at Doncaster but bumped into a very good horse in Funambule Sivola. He's ultra-consistent, has been in great form and goes there with an each-way chance. 25-02-22

He had a great campaign last season winning four times. He went up in the weights from 129 to 148 and this season he is going to find life considerably tougher. I couldn't be happier with how he has come back from his holidays and how he had been building up to the Byrne Group Chase, in which he finished third a couple of weeks ago. Things will be different to last year when we trained him for the opening Cheltenham meeting. This time we do not have a big target - we are going to find our feet and see where it takes him, particularly off a 19lb higher mark, but he is still capable of winning a big handicap at some stage. 09-11-22

runners.name: Fan De Blues
runners.comment: Very useful in his prime; returned from long absence with fair hunter chase run last month
runners.spotlight: Very useful handicap chaser for Willie Mullins in Ireland a couple of years ago; returned from long absence with respectable third (arguably second best on merit) in Leicester hunter chase (2m, good to soft) for new connections last month but needs to build on that performance here.

quotes.race: Co-Op Superstores Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: I was very disappointed with Fan De Blues' jumping because we thought that might be what wins it for him. At halfway I thought he was gone, but when Danny grabbed a hold of him and gave him a squeeze, giving him a lot of assistance, he was way better. He's probably a better horse than his handicap mark at the moment. Maybe the other horses were summer types who didn't go on that (rain-softened) ground. At the moment I'll keep him going and will stick to that trip, which seems to suit him better. I'll keep him to small runner races as I'm not sure he likes big fields - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Rockshore Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I think Fan De Blues was probably fortunate that the ones in front took each other on. When they finished battling he just had a little bit more in the tank. He has lots of experience and that experience probably told. He's a nice horse and we had been disappointed that he hadn't won for us over fences up until last time. I think that might be the start of it now as sometimes when a horse gets his head in front he gets the habit of it - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Swordlestown Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Fan De Blues jumped a bit left. I don't know why, it's not something he has done before. The tongue-tie helped - Brian Hayes, rider

quotes.race: Holycross Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: To do what he did today over a short trip, looking as big as a bull to me when I saw him with his number cloth on, was pleasing. I asked Daryl [Jacob] to be positive on him from the start and he was too positive on him, but when he got his second wind halfway down the straight he quickened again nicely. He's a real chaser but is only four and we'll keep him hurdling for this season, going up in trip. He's a nice new horse for Isaac Souede and Simon Munir - Willie Mullins, trainer of Fan De Blues

stable_tour.quote: I brought him back in trip to around two miles and a furlong for his last couple of starts and it's worked perfectly for him. We'll probably have to let him out in trip later on but if we can keep him to close to two miles I will. We've run him over all sorts of trips, but he likes jumping sharp and getting about his business. I think he can pay his way during the winter. 07-11-22

runners.name: Flagrant Delitiep
runners.comment: Regressive 10yo who has been pulled up in a hunter chase and three points this year
runners.spotlight: Regressive 10yo who has been pulled up in a Taunton hunter chase and three subsequent points this year; can't be recommended.

quotes.race: foxtrotracing.com Join Our Winning Syndicates Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I don't know a lot about Flagrant Delitiep but I still think there's plenty of improvement to come from him. He's a big boy and there's room to progress physically but he's a super jumper and is very straightforward. I like him - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Use The racingtv.com Tracker Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Flagrant Delitiep had a bit of seconditis so it's nice to see him get his head in front. He's an improving horse - Robert Walford, trainer.

runners.name: Sam Barton
runners.breeder: H R H The Princess Royal

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Disappointing under rules last season and has not shown much in recent points
runners.spotlight: Became very disappointing under rules for Emma Lavelle last season and has not shown a great deal in points for new stable this year.

quotes.race: Sporting Life EBF "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was confident even though we hit the front too soon, which I couldn't do much about as Sam Barton took me there. He's a fine horse, who's still a big baby, and he'll make a lovely chaser - Adam Wedge, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We thought he'd be a smashing chaser last season but it didn't happen. A slow maturer, he was a different animal when winning at Worcester two weeks ago. He jumped with confidence and battled. He doesn't want conditions too slow and should stay well. 02-11-22

He won his maiden hurdle last season at Doncaster but we plan to go chasing with him this year. His schooling last week was very good and I plan to start him off this Saturday at Ascot in a novice handicap chase over 2m4f. He has been crying out for fences and as he has strengthened up now is the right time and I expect him to do well. 26-10-21

runners.name: Viroflay
runners.comment: Clear second when back under rules at Stratford last month; high on the list here
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced over the last couple of years but was a wide-margin point winner in February and returned to racing under rules with good second at Stratford (2m5f, good to soft; front pair well clear) last month; very well suited by good ground; high on the list.

stable_tour.quote: We took him to Kempton in October for a race in which he started favourite but he was really disappointing, leaving me to think we'd end up running him in some novice handicaps at the smaller tracks. Seven days after Kempton we tried again, this time at Wincanton, where I said to Bryony that based on his previous week's run he would have no chance, but he hosed up. After Kempton Andy texted me and said: 'He's useless.' After Wincanton he texted me and said:'He'll win the Triumph'. He isn't going to be a Triumph horse but he could possibly be one for the Fred Winter. I've got a feeling he'll keep improving. 16-11-20

runners.name: Latenightfumble
runners.comment: Very promising pointer/hunter chaser a few years ago; returns from 786-day absence here
runners.spotlight: Looked a very promising pointer/hunter chaser a few years ago, most notably when winning at Cheltenham (3m2f, good) in April 2022, but we haven't seen her since February 2023.

quotes.race: NAF Intermediate Point-To-Point Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: If I'd known I was going to get there that easy, I would have waited a bit longer. Latenightfumble is a bit like her brother as she looks around when she gets to the front but this was a massive step up for her as she's only competed in points in small runner fields previously - Gina Andrews, jockey.

4:48.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Handicap

runners.name: Urban Sprawl

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Five turf wins; yet to strike on AW but has threatened, including last time
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner who extended his losing sequence on the AW to 15 when just missing out at Wolverhampton two weeks ago (8.6f); usually thereabouts and he stays this far.

quotes.race: Victoria Racing Club Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I had no idea whether I'd won or not, but Urban Sprawl is game and he's in good form. He was really gunning for the line and he was able to stick his head down where it matters. He's tough - David Probert, rider.

quotes.race: Twickenham Nursery Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Nursery Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Urban Sprawl probably won't go to Carlisle on Thursday. I don't know what Darley will want to do with him. He's quite exposed for one of theirs and is what he is, but is very genuine and Andrea said he could go a bit further, which could be key in getting more out of him. I don't think ground matters to him - Mark Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Robbo
runners.comment: Sound effort over C&D last time having been caught wide; has a kinder draw this time
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner for Charles Hills and nearly won a 7f handicap on final run for that yard; another sound effort over C&D last time having been caught wide; has a kinder draw this time and very much enters the equation.

stable_tour.quote: He's been training nicely. He was placed over six furlongs last season but we'll look to run him over seven soon. He's definitely shown enough to think he can win races. 17-04-24

runners.name: Hitched
runners.comment: Had excuses last time at Wolverhampton but the type who needs it all to drop right
runners.spotlight: Shot up the weights for winning four times through the winter (1m-1m2f) but only 3lb higher than for the last of those and he might have had some say last week at Wolverhampton (8.6f) but for hanging and losing his place before running on again; hold-up performer who will need everything to drop right.

runners.name: Savvy Kingdom
runners.comment: Didn't look well treated for handicap debut and duly struggled; long-time absent
runners.spotlight: 7f novice winner who didn't look on a strikingly generous mark when well held on his handicap debut at Sandown (7f); that was in September 2023 so he's been off a long time and returns just 4lb lower.

runners.name: Lunario
runners.owner: Christmas Party, M Watt & R David
runners.comment: Three-time turf winner who is 0-7 on the AW and seemingly inferior on these surfaces
runners.spotlight: Three-time turf winner who is 0-7 on the AW and seemingly inferior on these surfaces; new trainer fits new headgear and he looks best watched back from a break.

runners.name: Future Cutlet
runners.comment: Makes stable debut after five months off but his profile is progressive
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f maiden at Down Royal in September before finishing well for fourth in a Dundalk 1m handicap (AW); makes stable debut after five months off but his profile is progressive.

quotes.race: Madrí Excepcional Maiden
quotes.quote: I thought Future Cutlet won well. I had to make him work in the last furlong to get there, and he'll probably get further in time - Billy Lee, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Port Road
runners.comment: Second when fav for a 7f Class 5 last time; finished well and now returns to 1m
runners.spotlight: 0-8, though only 0-3 for this yard; came up short in a lower-grade handicap at Kempton last time (7f) but was a strong favourite and the manner in which he kept on suggests 1m might be more suitable.

runners.name: The Bitter Moose
runners.comment: Changed hands for 18,000gns and his best form for previous yard makes him a player
runners.spotlight: Two 7f AW wins for previous yard included one here and very nearly won again when last seen at Chelmsford in October (1m; second-time visor); has since changed hands for 18,000gns and has further wins in him.

runners.name: Enpassant
runners.comment: Running well until last time at Kempton where he was keen off the pace and never counted
runners.spotlight: Running well until last time at Kempton where he was keen off the pace and never counted; reliable in the main and has a big effort in him.

3:38.race_name: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap

runners.name: Haaland
runners.comment: Wasn't on song when beaten favourite here (2m) latest; given a short break since; chance.
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins (1m2f-2m), including in first-time cheekpieces at Newcastle in October 2023; shaped encouragingly on first two starts for current yard but wasn't on song when a beaten favourite here (2m) latest; given a 73-day break since, so interesting to see how he fares over a shorter trip; chance.

runners.name: Poncho
runners.comment: Course winner (2m) in December; latest run (fourth) broadly on par; 1m5f the risk-factor?
runners.spotlight: Didn't convince (carried head high) but managed to get the job done over 2m here (beating Alright Sunshine) last December; ran to a similar level on RPR's when fourth (beaten over 5l) back here latest, a form line boosted by Cool Party at Kempton on Saturday; shorter trip mightn't necessarily suit.

runners.name: Upepo
runners.comment: Acquitted himself well at Wolverhampton (1m4f; from career-high mark) last week; respected
runners.spotlight: Five AW wins (1m4f-1m5f), the last two of which were under the guidance of the 3lb claimer Jack Doughty; acquitted himself well when third at Wolverhampton (1m4f; from a career-high mark) last week, so merits ample respect in this relatively tight-knit contest.

runners.name: Dance Time

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late L R Owen

runners.comment: Consistent mare (3-11 AW); runner-up at Southwell (1m6f) latest; first visit to Lingfield.
runners.spotlight: Consistent mare (3-11 AW) who has undertaken most of her recent racing at Southwell and Wolverhampton; 3lb above her last winning mark, and headed inside the final furlong when having the tables turned by Rogue Tornado at Southwell (1m6f; 5-1) latest; first visit to Lingfield.

stable_tour.quote: She's done extremely well, putting on a serious amount of weight. I think she's put on 85kg since last season. She's a bull of a filly. How she did as well as she did at two and three is amazing really - she's a bit of an enigma. She has a super attitude. She's probably two or three weeks away from a run and I think we'll have some fun with her as she's very well-handicapped off 67. 30-05-24

runners.name: Wannabe Brave
runners.comment: Fine AW record (5-20); just held on comeback at Wolverhampton (2m) last week; major player
runners.spotlight: Fine AW record (5-20; also placed eight times) and was operating right at the top of his game when just held at Wolverhampton (2m; beaten a short-head) last week; is entitled to be sharper for that comeback, so there's a strong probability he'll be bang there again; key player.

runners.name: Alright Sunshine
runners.comment: Unfortunate at Southwell (1m6f; this rider eased him near finish) in February; poor since.
runners.spotlight: Has previous with today's rival Poncho and should have won at Southwell (1m6f; this rider eased him near the finish, earning a suspension) in February; however, it's difficult to be enthused by his subsequent efforts, principally when refusing to race at Chelmsford; safer to look elsewhere.

quotes.race: Visit The All New racinguk.com "Junior" Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Alright Sunshine is a nice type who has done it well and should improve plenty for it. He's well-related and they quite like him at home - Brian Hughes, jockey.

runners.name: Zariela
runners.comment: Sole win came when making all in modest C&D maiden last September; seasonal reappearance.
runners.spotlight: Sole win came when making all in a modest C&D maiden (4-5 favourite) last September; toiled in soft ground at Yarmouth (1m2f) on final start last year; returns to action back over a mile in more suitable conditions; isn't discounted.

runners.name: Daisy Roots
runners.comment: Won twice over this trip (Salisbury and Windsor) last summer; every chance on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Won twice over this trip (Salisbury and Windsor) last summer, rising in the weights as a result; below par at Nottingham (8.5f; soft) on final start for Adam West; Lingfield form figures read 461422, so has every chance if ready to roll on stable debut.

runners.name: Willows Kiss
runners.comment: Fifth on handicap debut at Chelmsford (7f, 50-1); stamina is untested beyond 7f.
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo; took a backward step from her previous start (here, 7f) when fifth on handicap debut at Chelmsford (7f; 50-1); stamina untested beyond 7f, but there's scope to think that she'll stay with her dam enjoying success over this trip; improvement necessary.

runners.name: Disclosure
runners.comment: Maiden (0-11); easing in the weights on first start for James Owen; needs a market check.
runners.spotlight: Still seeking her first win (0-11) with RPR's implying that she was regressing for George Boughey; changed hands in January for 1,500gns and has eased further in the weights (with a 7lb claimer booked) on first start for James Owen; needs a market check.

runners.name: Help Me Rhonda

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Paul Shanahan & Mrs M V Magnier & T V Magnier
Mrs Paul Shanahan, M V Magnier, T V Magnier

runners.comment: Kempton winner (1m) last October; hasn't had things go her way since; highest on shortlist
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win on her third start for this trainer at Kempton (1m; 5-1) last October; less productive, with obvious mitigating circumstances, in two starts since; remains on a workable mark, so rates highest on shortlist for first visit to Lingfield.

runners.name: Guns And Flowers
runners.comment: Sole win came as a juvenile at Chelmsford (6f) in June 2023; low-key for this trainer.
runners.spotlight: Sole win came as a juvenile at Chelmsford (6f; first run for Alice Haynes) in June 2023; yet to show much, at double-figure odds, in three starts for this trainer, but it's possible that she'll strip fitter for Kempton, and she's 2lb lower again; others make more appeal.

2:02.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Twilight Madness
runners.owner: P R Hedger & P C F Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Potentially dangerous off this mark but has been out for a year
runners.spotlight: Seven wins include a C&D success in late 2023, his final victory; potentially dangerous off this mark but has been out for a year.

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Twilight Madness gave me a really good feel up to halfway but the horse who was making it couldn't really take me far enough and he was dossing a bit once in front - Jason Hart, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Invincible Speed
runners.comment: Takes a drop in class here but has not yet fired for his current yard
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come at Wolverhampton; takes a drop in class here but has not yet fired for his current yard.

runners.name: Get Jiggy With It
runners.comment: Made a quiet debut for her new yard, albeit in a Class 4 (first-time tongue-tie)
runners.spotlight: Won only once for Charles Hills and became expensive to follow; picked up for 50,000gns and made a quiet debut for her new yard, albeit in a Class 4 (first-time tongue-tie).

runners.name: Brunel Charm

prev_owners.owner: R Lane & Exors Of The Late S Needham

runners.comment: Up 9lb for exploiting a soft lead last time but Jack Dace's claim takes care of 7lb
runners.spotlight: Not many 6f handicaps are won by more than 5l but that was the case at Chelmsford where he made the most of a soft lead; this might not pan out so favourably but he's on his game right now and Jack Dace's claim assists with the 9lb rise.

stable_tour.quote: He is a very consistent horse who always tries his best, which is backed up by his record of two wins, eight seconds and a handful of thirds. He is actually a hard horse to find races for at this time of the year as his best form is on the all-weather, hence he has a handicap mark 6lb higher on the artificial surfaces. We may try him on the grass again but I would prefer to run him on the all-weather. To my mind, he is a winner waiting to happen at the moment. 29-06-23

runners.name: Northcliff

prev_owners.owner: S Bulmer, P Hebdon & R Taylor

runners.comment: In decent form as he found some trouble when fourth last time at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: Has dipped beneath his last winning mark (at Ascot last May) and comes here in decent form as he found some trouble when fourth last time at Wolverhampton; considered.

runners.name: Tyger Bay
runners.comment: Stall 1 might not be ideal for one who does have a tendency to miss the break
runners.spotlight: Exposed 8yo but remains very capable and a slow start was no help when behind Charlie Mason last time at Southwell (6f); does have a tendency to miss the kick (though not always) and that would spell danger from stall one; 6lb higher when a close third in this last year.

runners.name: Charlie Mason
runners.comment: On a tough mark but he's a consistent gelding who should run well again
runners.spotlight: On a tough mark but he's a consistent gelding who ran another sound race at Southwell three weeks ago (6f); 0-5 here but has placed form and should go well.

runners.name: Profit And Loss
runners.breeder: M Sundstrom, Anglia Bloodstock Et Al
runners.comment: Defied a wide trip to beat four rivals here a month ago; only 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner in Jersey and, on his second run back for previous trainer George Baker, he defied a wide trip to beat four rivals here a month ago; only 3lb higher.

runners.name: One More Dream
runners.comment: Responded well to the new blinkers when beaten 2l at Southwell four days ago
runners.spotlight: Not in the same form as he was 12 months ago but he did win at Wolverhampton in February and responded well to the new blinkers when beaten 2l at Southwell four days ago; not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He's a decent all-weather horse and has won at Newcastle and Southwell this month and been second twice. He may switch back to turf but dry ground is quite important to him. When he's right he tries very hard and he's the sort who's important to the yard because he can win two or three a year and if every horse did that you'd have an awful lot of winners. He's entered at Newcastle on Friday. 20-03-24

runners.name: Pacifist
runners.owner: Miss D Finkler, A Herd, Dr P Holloway 1
runners.comment: Straightforward maiden win from the front over 1m at Newcastle; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: It wasn't much of a maiden that she won at Newcastle (1m) but it was straightforward from the front and she's bred for this longer trip; should give herself every chance on handicap debut.

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pacifist was very straightforward and galloped out all the way to the line. I think she could step up in trip going forward - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: War Hawk
runners.comment: Never nearer than at the finish on handicap debut over 8.6f at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of his three qualifying races; gelded ahead of handicap debut at Wolverhampton (8.6f; 4-1) and it was quite eyecatching in how he finished his race from off the pace; can improve again.

runners.name: Yielding To None
runners.owner: Mrs Heather Ann Chakko And Simon Dow
runners.comment: Patiently ridden when third here two runs back; different tactics adopted last time
runners.spotlight: Best run was his penultimate one when coming from last to finish third of the five runners in a 7f novice here; ridden differently on his return visit and weakened; could pay his way in handicaps.

runners.name: Pershalla
runners.comment: Beaten a shade over 3l in two C&D novices through the winter; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Beaten a shade over 3l in two C&D novices through the winter and might not be overburdened for this handicap debut; considered.

runners.name: Bownder
runners.comment: Form figures of 312212 in his first six handicaps; may have needed latest run
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 312212 in his first six handicaps (all at 1m) and may have needed it after a break four weeks ago; on a competitive mark.

runners.name: Moonlit Stage
runners.comment: Got it together last year after being gelded, finishing 212 in 9.4f-1m2f handicaps
runners.spotlight: Got it together last year after being gelded, finishing 212 in 9.4f-1m2f handicaps; has crept up the weights but should continue to give a good account.

runners.name: Crackamour
runners.comment: He's raised in distance for this handicap debut and the yard won this last year
runners.spotlight: Not the obvious answer on what he's shown in his first three races but he's raised in distance for this handicap debut and the yard won this last year.

2:32.race_name: Win £1m With BetMGM's Golden Goals Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Bigfield Dreams
runners.owner: Nick Bradley Racing 41 And A Haynes
runners.comment: Down the field in both her races (1m) and handicaps will be more like it
runners.spotlight: Down the field in both her races (1m) and handicaps will be more like it.

runners.name: Mandana
runners.comment: Below par last time but had run well in four previous starts; hood added
runners.spotlight: Below par last time but had run well in her four previous starts at about 7f and she has some of the best form in this field; hood added.

runners.name: Eleonora Gonzaga
runners.comment: Has no obvious form claims after defeats over 6f on turf and 1m on the AW
runners.spotlight: Has no obvious form claims after heavy enough defeats over 6f on turf and 1m on the AW.

runners.name: Fantasmic
runners.comment: Beaten about 7l over C&D a month ago but the winner was a useful long odds-on chance
runners.spotlight: Positive pedigree; beaten about 7l over C&D a month ago but stuck to her task and the winner was a useful long odds-on chance.

runners.name: Grande Armee
runners.owner: All For One Racing Vi And Partner
runners.comment: Drawn wide here and handicaps will soon be the way forward
runners.spotlight: Very green on debut but then beat only one home at Southwell (1m); drawn wide here and handicaps will soon be the way forward.

runners.name: Lady Aiyana
runners.comment: Related to winners under both codes and needs checking in the market
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; half-sister to six winners including Carntop (1m; RPR 106; 2m hurdle), Mitre Peak (9.4f AW; 86) and Caldwell (1m4f/2m AW Flat, 84; 2m hurdle/chase); dam 1m winner (94), half-sister to Arc winner Rail Link; needs checking in the market.

runners.name: Phyllis Burton
runners.comment: Half-sister to a bumper winner and 1m/1m4f AW winner Path To Dubai
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to winners Audacity (Listed bumper) and Path To Dubai (1m/1m4f AW; RPR 90); dam 11.5f/1m4f winner and half-sister to French 1m4f winner Gaius Caesar; the market should be instructive.

runners.name: Pomme Pomme
runners.comment: Dam 7.4f 2yo winner (RPR 85) and half-sister to 1m1f 2yo Listed winner Wovoka
runners.spotlight: 7,000euros yearling; third foal; dam 7.4f 2yo winner (RPR 85) and half-sister to 1m1f 2yo Listed winner Wovoka; another newcomer to watch closely in the betting.

runners.name: Princess Mia
runners.comment: Ran a bit better to be third over C&D three months ago; needs more but that is feasible
runners.spotlight: Never well positioned when fifth on debut and ran a bit better to be third over C&D three months ago; needs more but that is feasible.

runners.name: Sixteen One
runners.comment: 0-5 but has form claims in a race of this nature and she's raised in distance
runners.spotlight: Hadn't progressed from a promising debut but steadied the ship with a third over 7f here last time (January) and she's up in distance with cheekpieces added; in the mix.

runners.name: Three On Thursday

prev_owners.owner: Gee Gee's Wine Bar & Dylan Cunha

runners.comment: No real threat in a 6f AW novice last July but the run wasn't without promise
runners.spotlight: No real threat in a 6f AW novice last July but the run wasn't without promise and she steps up to 1m; new yard.

5:20.race_name: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap

runners.name: Harb
runners.breeder: Boyce Bloodstock & Mrs C E Percival
runners.comment: Needs things to pan out favourably for him but capable when that happens
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who edged out Recon Mission here in November but hasn't been quite so clever since, even when second to a well-in rival here a month ago; needs things to pan out favourably for him but capable when that happens.

quotes.race: Amazing Sri Lanka Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Series Sprint Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I'd love to say this was the plan, but it was more to have a run and then bring him back to the race he won last year. I knew he was pretty sharp, on Monday he dropped our lad who rides him every day and galloped round the field like a good'un, which gave him that last piece of work in a way. I said to his owner the morning, 'Don't think this horse hasn't got a chance', because he was as fit as I could get him at this stage. Sure enough, he's shown that. Harb is wonderful, I love him to bits, but I've also got another horse I'm really excited about called Harry Brown. I've got really high hopes for later in the year - Peter Crate, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Harb has had a bit of a break as we thought he needed it and Peter said about running here so I said 'go on' and he has done it well. When Tom (Queally, jockey) got off him at Epsom he said we should try a mile - there was no way on God's earth he was going to get it, but you have to listen to the likes of Tom and give the horse a chance.I actually walked away as everywhere he was going he was getting blocked in, but he has ended up doing that well - Pat Gallagher, owner.

stable_tour.quote: Has been working well and will run soon, 18-04-21

runners.name: Coolagh Magic
runners.owner: Lady Emma Oshea And A Carson
runners.comment: He's always been behind in his last two races and needs to get back on track
runners.spotlight: Multiple AW winner (including here) but he's always been behind in his last two races and needs to get back on track; what will help is a strong pace up front.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Home Of The Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Coolagh Magic jumped out well and when I asked for a change of gear, he'd gone. He's always worked quite well and is probably getting quicker, having won over five here - Tony Hamilton, rider.
