stable_tour.quote: He only came to us this summer and I deliberately didn't rush him. I thought he would go well first time out at Lingfield earlier this month but it was a pleasant surprise to see him come home in front. In his younger days he had won off a loftier mark, but he has been working well and I expect him to go on from here. 15-09-21

runners.name: Micks Spirit
runners.comment: Course specialist; below par of late and not the only runner who likes to force the pace
runners.spotlight: All except one of his eight wins have been here, the latest in January when narrowly repelling Recon Mission; however, below par the last twice and he's not the only runner who likes to force the pace.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: We backed Mick's Spirit at 28s. I couldn't believe he kept drifting so it's wonderful. I haven't had him in such good form since the last time he won - Conrad Allen, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Betway Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Mick's Spirit was very fizzy early on but he's learnt to settle. We took the hood off today, dropped him back to five furlongs and he won quite nicely. We're really happy with him and he should have a future in handicaps - Conrad Allen, trainer.

runners.name: Midnightattheoasis
runners.comment: Doubly penalised for last week's two wins but might still be ahead of the game
runners.spotlight: Carries a double penalty for winning twice within three days last week, latterly leading late on over C&D with the front two pulling clear; that was a fine effort from off the pace and this too should be run to suit him.

quotes.race: BetUK: It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: Rossa [Ryan] has clicked with him and that was an unbelievable ride he gave Midnightattheoasis. I was worried about him going down the hill and that played out in the race, but luckily Rossa switched him inside round the bend and that galvanised him. The drop back to five has worked a treat. He travels very strongly and we ran him a lot over six furlongs but I'll hold my hands up and say that was trainer error. It was more by accident we popped him in at Wolverhampton two weeks ago but we've found the key to him now. He'll still only be off 61 [at Chelmsford next Thursday], and he was rated 70 at one point. We're lucky to have plenty of turnout and he won't have the tack on him until he goes to Chelmsford, which works well for these sprinters - Phil McEntee, trainer.

runners.name: Recon Mission
runners.comment: No excuses from a good position last time and his losing run is mounting up
runners.spotlight: Consistent in the main but had no excuses from a good position last time at Wolverhampton and his losing run is mounting up.

quotes.race: Oxshott Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't sure (if I'd held on) but the second horse just gave me a nudge towards the line and with these older sprinters, it has probably helped me more than anything as he'd just got a little bit lonely in front. He was hanging left towards the stands and I just needed a bit of company towards the line - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: Terry Mills Handicap
quotes.quote: Recon Mission has been unlucky in a couple of runs, but the small field suited and he's won here before. He's had a long old season and you can't keep going with these horses, so he won't have too many more races before a break. He'll be back here next year for the Dash - Brian Millen, owner.

quotes.race: Epsom Downs Welcomes Back Owners Handicap
quotes.quote: Recon Mission had run well here previously in the Dash and this was a step on the way back to that race. He'll probably go straight there now. We've run him over six furlongs and tried to hang on to him but he didn't enjoy it as he likes to roll - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Pavers Foundation Catherine Memorial Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: Recon Mission is a very talented horse who likes it in front. The ground is very important for him as he needs a bit of cut. There are options in France and Ireland and he could be one for the Ayr Gold Cup later in the season - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Become A Member At Fairyhouse Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He's a lovely horse. There's another nursery for him in a few weeks but the handicapper might be hard enough on him after winning by three lengths. There is also a Listed race over 5f in a few weeks for him as well so we might go for that - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer

runners.name: The Defiant
runners.comment: Not the easiest to predict but well drawn for one who likes to force it
runners.spotlight: Down the field in races won by today's opposition before coming good with a narrow success at Wolverhampton (5f); not the easiest to predict as subsequent defeats confirm, but well drawn for one who likes to force it.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a good performance, I thought Kev executed it great, The Defiant jumped a bit quicker than he has been. We decided after the last day we'd make more use of his early speed and he was always in control. He'll develop into a decent sort of horse, he's from a late-maturing family so he should progress a bit further with a bit of luck - Paul Midgley, trainer.

runners.name: Beaumadier

prev_owners.owner: Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & E J Dwyer & M C Grassick

runners.comment: Runs well now and again but only 1-20 overall and new headgear now goes on
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in races won by Coolagh Magic and The Defiant before a disappointing run at Wolverhampton; that took his strike-rate to 1-20 and new headgear now goes on.

7:00.race_name: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap

runners.name: Jungle Land
runners.breeder: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
runners.comment: Successful over C&D last week on reappearance and may have more to offer on this surface
runners.spotlight: Recorded a 1l success in similar event over C&D last week on reappearance, producing a career-best performance; incurs 5lb penalty but may have more to offer on this surface; respected.

runners.name: Cargin Bhui
runners.comment: Flopped in blinkers last time but remains of interest; now goes in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Flipped in blinkers here last time but could rebound if the switch to cheekpieces suits; has otherwise shown signs that he's capable of winning a race of this nature and remains of interest.

runners.name: Giant
runners.comment: Fairly useful 7f handicapper who shapes as if this drop in distance is worth exploring
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful 7f handicapper; beaten only 2l in both runs this year; this is his first crack at sprinting but he shapes as if the drop in distance is worth exploring; therefore interesting off a workable mark.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the gelding (operation) has helped and a bit of a break and Giant has come back fresh and well. Everything went to plan and he's done it nicely - Richard Spencer, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Digital
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing And Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Lacks recent match practice and isn't crying out for this step back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Lacks recent match practice and isn't crying out for the step back up in trip, having done most of his winning over 5f; recorded sole 6f success in claiming grade; not the percentage call.

quotes.race: Book Tickets For Ladies Night @hamilton-park.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: Ruth (Carr) just said to me, "I can't get Digital any better than he is, he's in real good form." - jockey Paul Mulrennan, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: I've always held him in high regard. He jumped a little keen at Newbury and taking him back was probably the wrong thing to do. He hit the line well when third over six furlongs at Southwell so we have the option of that trip but he'll probably stay over five for now. He goes to York this week. 10-05-22

He's another well handicapped horse. He was decent on his day for Kevin Ryan -he's had a couple of different yards in between coming to us. He ran for us for the first time over 6f at Southwell at the end of March and ran with loads of enthusiasm for an older horse. He'll come on for that run and he goes to Kempton on Wednesday. Between 5f and 6f is his best trip. Some of the owners have been with him since he was a two-year-old. 17-04-24

runners.name: Hectic
runners.breeder: Miss Nell Kent & Miss Sophie Bates
runners.comment: Won at Southwell on final start for Roger Fell; still unexposed at this trip and on AW
runners.spotlight: Absent since taking well to first-time visor at Southwell (6f) in October on final start for Roger Fell; headgear is removed but he's still unexposed over this distance and on AW; not ruled out.

quotes.race: bet365 EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Hectic is very straightforward, he trains himself. We've made a lot of entries for him and when we've gone to declare we haven't. He was there to be shot at in front and there's a lot of improvement to come. Dobby loved him and said the ground didn't feel that quick on him; I'd say the ground's lovely. You might look at something like the Acomb, and he's very nice. He's a heavy-set, strong lad, so we'll have to be careful and I'd say he'd get seven furlongs no problem. That was probably quite a smart race - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We struggled to get him back last year after he failed mentally to handle his second outing at York. He ran a super race in a Newbury handicap over seven furlongs on soft ground on his reappearance, though, and I think he'll be a lot better on a sounder surface and with that run under his belt. I was disappointed he went up 6lb, but I think he'll still be very competitive in good handicaps on his way to the Britannia. 02-05-23

Some of the horses just aren't getting their heads in front and this guy is one. He's taken a couple of runs to get fit this year but he's got them under his belt now. He ran a massive race to finish fourth at York last month under Hollie Doyle and we were pleased with that. Unfortunately at Doncaster on his next start, Kieran O'Neill dropped his reins in the last 100 yards and we were just beaten in a photo-finish by Silver Samurai. He might go to Pontefract on Sunday and he'll be a solid handicapper who'll go to the likes of York and be competitive - he was a good fifth there last weekend. 21-06-24

runners.name: Mumayaz
runners.comment: Unlucky third here in most recent 6f attempt; possibilities back at this distance
runners.spotlight: Below par over 7f last time; generally in good form when racing over 6f this year, winning in January/February and an unlucky third at this venue in March; possibilities back down in trip.

quotes.race: knees.co.uk Home And Electrical 145th Anniversary Handicap
quotes.quote: Jack [Doughty] gave Mumayaz a lovely ride. He's been consistent all year. He had a great all-weather campaign and we've been very pleased with him - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Grant Thornton Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Mumayaz was planned to sit in the first three but they went very hard and I rode him with confidence. He's quite versatile and we've always liked him, he seems to have turned a corner. He's an honest horse - Chris Hayes, rider.

runners.name: Muscika
runners.comment: Veteran who has proved very consistent (form figures 1332) this year; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has proved consistent this year, producing form figures of 1332; ran creditably, one place in front of unlucky Mumayaz, over C&D most recently; solid chance off same mark.

quotes.race: Find More Big Deals At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Muscika is a lovely old boy. The last day at Epsom went really well and today went the same, he jumped out and has a nice gate speed, which is good from a low draw here. We went a nice enough gallop but I didn't have to use too much petrol and he travelled into it well. He's really found his form again - Cieren Fallon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Muscika jumped well and I got a very, very soft lead, surprisingly. We dawdled in front and then kicked and just nicked the race. He's an old boy, he's in good form and he was unlucky to get touched off at Wolverhampton the last day. He's handled the track very well. He's well balanced and he travels, which is what you need. He was true and honest to the line and I couldn't pull him up towards the end. Jockeys dream for rides like that where you jump out, bowl along and nothing catches you. It was like a piece of work and we never saw another rival - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extended Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always thought there was a good race in Muscika and he's proved it today. We might look at going back for the Great St Wilfrid after he finished fourth in it last year - Richard Walker, racing manager for owners Gallop Racing.

quotes.race: JW 4x4 Northallerton Handicap
quotes.quote: Muscika was dropped in last time and went a bit sour with it, so the boss said ride him handy. He travelled through the race great and quickened up before idling a bit when in front. He's a fine horse and hopefully there's more to come - Cam Hardie, jockey

quotes.race: Visit The Start Today Maiden Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Muscika is a nice big horse, but he is still a bit raw and green. He ran on well in the closing stages when the penny dropped. He may stay further but he could get quicker with racing - David O'Meara, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Won two nice races at York last year and seems to like the place. He's had some good runs this season and probably paid the price late on for going too fast at Ripon last time. He'll be kept going in the nice sprint handicaps, including at York. 10-05-21

runners.name: Dicko The Legend
runners.owner: Mrs S Hibbert, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.comment: In-form contender who has been placed in last three runs; should remain competitive
runners.spotlight: In-form contender who has been placed in last three outings, latest at Southwell behind a subsequent scorer; still only 1lb above last winning mark and is likely to remain competitive.

runners.name: Gogo Yubari

prev_owners.owner: Gee Gee's Wine Bar & Dylan Cunha

runners.comment: Strong finisher over 5f here most recently (final start for Dylan Cunha); in the mix
runners.spotlight: Productive sprinter in the first half of 2024, winning five times; largely consistent form this year, strong-finishing third over 5f here most recently (final start for Dylan Cunha); in the mix.

quotes.race: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We paid five grand for Gogo Yubari at the mares' sale and we've won five races and had two places from ten starts in four months; it's been unreal - Dylan Cunha, trainer.

runners.name: Kamekist
runners.comment: Half-brother to a 6f winner; interesting dropped to this trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Placed in a couple of 7f contests at Wolverhampton this year, weakening inside the final 1f latest; half-brother to a 6f winner and looks interesting dropped to this trip on handicap debut, with progress plausible.

runners.name: Nad Alshiba Rain
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden; has form figures of 343 for new yard; frame possibilities
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who has form figures of 343 since joining new yard; has frame possibilities as things stand and win possibilities if finding some improvement.

runners.name: Rokuni
runners.comment: Combination of return to sprinting and first-time visor gives him possibilities
runners.spotlight: 6f winner who has failed to improve since upped to 7f/1m, latterly for new yard; combination of return to sprinting and first-time visor gives him possibilities off a reduced mark.

runners.name: Style King
runners.comment: Cut little ice in 2yo events for Roger Varian; sold for 3,000gns since last run
runners.spotlight: Cut little ice in 2yo events for Roger Varian; gelded and sold for 3,000gns since last run; the betting may prove best guide on handicap/stable debut.

runners.name: Kiss Me My Love
runners.comment: Turf winner; two creditable winter efforts since switched to AW; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Won on turf last summer; couple of creditable winter efforts since switched to AW, racing from the front both times; dropped another 1lb and could make a bold bid.

runners.name: The Thames Lady
runners.owner: Nigel Scandrett, Shane Buy, Karen Jankel
runners.comment: Won at Lingfield on handicap debut; perhaps best to forgive subsequent effort
runners.spotlight: Raced prominently when scoring at Lingfield (6f) on handicap debut and was less effective under contrasting tactics at Kempton since; may still have more to offer.

runners.name: Triple Charged
runners.comment: Maiden whose form has dipped in two runs for new stable
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden whose form has dipped in two starts for new stable; well treated on best efforts but is seemingly starting to regress.

runners.name: Rumba Bay
runners.comment: Has form figures of 6131 for new yard, winning over C&D most recently; respected
runners.spotlight: Maiden in Ireland; has form figures of 6131 since joining new yard and switched to AW, justifying favouritism over C&D (only second 6f attempt) most recently; respected with further improvement possible.

runners.name: Summer Rain
runners.comment: Has achieved little in two handicaps; may do better with David Egan on board
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise at maiden/novice level but has achieved little in two handicaps, latest over C&D; may do better with David Egan up for first time.

5:25.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Douglas Dc
runners.comment: Third over C&D last month, but a record of 1-40 under rules is hard to ignore
runners.spotlight: Appeared to respond well to the fitting of blinkers when third of nine over C&D last month, splitting Two Plus Two and Disquietude; races off the same mark, but a record of 1-40 under rules is hard to ignore; stable runs four.

stable_tour.quote: Never got into the race last time at Downpatrick, but is quite a versatile sort and should pay his way this season. He'll mix and match between hurdles and fences. 24-10-23

He was second at Leicester last week on the Flat behind Thrilling Dream. He's never won on the Flat but has been placed many times. He has won over jumps in the past for Gordon Elliott in Ireland and will probably go jumping again soon over 2m. He was placed twice in the winter over hurdles at Sandown and was fourth in a handicap hurdle at Ascot at 125-1 behind Titan Discovery. 07-08-24

runners.name: Jailbird
runners.comment: Needs a bit more back on the Flat on second start since wind surgery
runners.spotlight: 2lb higher than when winning at Lingfield (11.6f, good to firm) for another yard last summer; best of four runs over hurdles for this stable when third of 12 (albeit a distant one) in February when back from wind surgery; needs a bit more returned to the Flat.

runners.name: Got Bright
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Treli
runners.comment: Makes his stable debut after 18 months off; this is unlikely to be far enough for him now
runners.spotlight: Won twice on turf in France (1m1f/10.5f) in France in March 2021, but 0-15 under both codes subsequently; makes his debut for a new yard after 18 months off and this is unlikely to be far enough for him now; watch market.

runners.name: Broad Daylight
runners.comment: 0-11 on turf for Jim Bolger; watch market on stable/AW debut after a year off
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden who became disappointing on turf for Jim Bolger; picked up for 4,000gns last summer and although out of a half-sister to an AW Listed winner, still has enough to prove upped in trip on stable debut after a year off; market informative.

runners.name: Avarice
runners.comment: C&D winner and successful at Lingfield eight days ago; more appealing than most
runners.spotlight: Not the most prolific (3-31) but he has winning form over C&D and with cheekpieces back on he landed a cosy success in a 0-50 classified event at Lingfield (1m4f, Polytrack) eight days ago; has more on his plate back in a handicap under a 4lb penalty, but still more appealing than most; stable also runs Disquietude.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Div II)
quotes.quote: He's a lovely genuine horse and does all the donkey work at home leading babies and younger horses. He wants 1m4f but the rain played to his strengths over that trip. Eventually he should make a proper jumper as there is a bit of class about him - assistant trainer Shane Lyons.

stable_tour.quote: He has been very disappointing as we thought we were buying a horse who would do much better than he has. It's his second season with us since coming over from Ireland and he's only won once. He has come down the ratings to 64 having been 84 on his first run for us. He's having a break now and will come back for a campaign on the all-weather this winter. 23-09-22

runners.name: Marinakis
runners.comment: Running consistently well on the AW this year including two wins; big player if he stays
runners.spotlight: Running consistently well on the AW this year, including wins in 0-50 classified events at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) in January and here (9.5f) five weeks ago; more to do back in a handicap and he steps up over 2f in trip, but his sire's stamina influence should help; big player if he stays.

quotes.race: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Classified Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: I had to wait [to get a run] but it probably did me a favour, I hit the front a little bit sooner on Marinakis the last day. The cheekpieces definitely helped him but he did it well - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Honrado
runners.breeder: Lofts Hall Stud & Mrs C R Philipson

prev_owners.owner: Oti Racing, Lofts Hall Stud & Partner

runners.comment: Hasn't built on a good second at Lingfield in January and now 0-15
runners.spotlight: Looked a winner waiting to happen when second of ten behind a bang-in-form rival at Lingfield (1m4f, Polytrack; first-time cheekpieces) in January, but twice disappointing back there since (behind two of these eight days ago); now 0-15 and others are preferred.

runners.name: Two Plus Two
runners.comment: Has some good form here this year but hard to predict and doesn't look an easy ride; risky
runners.spotlight: 1-22, his win coming over 1m6f here in January; went close over C&D last month, but didn't back it up in a 0-50 classified event back here 17 days ago; hard to predict and he doesn't always look an easy ride; risky.

runners.name: Walk The Moon
runners.comment: In the frame in his first four starts over C&D this year, but is now 0-24
runners.spotlight: In the frame in his first four starts over C&D this year, but finished about 5l behind Avarice in a 0-50 classified event at Lingfield (1m4f, Polytrack) eight days ago; return here should help, but he is now 0-24 so another placing may be his best hope.

runners.name: Disquietude
runners.comment: 0-13 but has made the frame in five of her six starts this year; frame material again
runners.spotlight: 0-13 but has made the frame in five of her six starts this year, finishing close behind Two Plus Two and Douglas Dc over C&D early last month and third of nine (just behind Walk The Moon) in a 0-50 classified event back here 12 days later (met trouble); frame material again.

runners.name: This Time Maybe
runners.comment: 0-16 but has run well in defeat a few times this year; others preferred for win purposes
runners.spotlight: 0-16 but has run well in defeat a few times this year, as when twice placed over C&D in January; down 1lb and no reason why he shouldn't go well again, but others are preferred for win purposes.

runners.name: Temur Khan
runners.comment: Badly out of form when last seen and plenty to prove back from six months off
runners.spotlight: Winner of eight races and best known for his Brighton exploits, but he has won three times on the AW; badly out of form when last seen, though, and plenty to prove back from six months off.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Apprentice Handicap (Hands And Heels Race) (Racing Excellence Series)
quotes.quote: The plan was just patience. Temur Khan went through the race nicely and picked up well - Molly Gunn, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go to Brighton and is entered in the 1m4f classified stakes on Thursday. He won there last October and also at the early August meeting there in 2021 and twice in 2022. He won the other day at Lingfield, so he'll arrive there in good form. He goes on any ground and should run very well. 07-08-24

6:30.race_name: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Masterofperfection
runners.comment: Last of 12 at Salisbury in sole 2yo start; gelded since
runners.spotlight: Finished last of 12 at Salisbury (1m) in sole 2yo start, having been friendless in the betting; gelded since; best watched unless the market signals go the other way.

runners.name: Nobleman
runners.comment: Went down by only a whisker at Kempton most recently; leading claims
runners.spotlight: From a family that has served his connections well and he is duly threatening to open his account; went down by only a whisker at Kempton (1m4f) most recently, taking form figures to 622; leading claims.

runners.name: Unknown Journey
runners.comment: Failed to improve for blinkers last time; now goes in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Has ordinary form and failed to improve for first-time blinkers in C&D handicap most recently; chance of winning depends on whether the switch to cheekpieces has a better effect.

runners.name: Doddington Guy
runners.comment: Newcomer by Postponed out of a modest maiden for his connections
runners.spotlight: Newcomer by Postponed out of a modest maiden for his connections; not particularly interesting, unless the betting speaks favourably.

runners.name: King Kernow
runners.owner: E Duffy, B Taggart, Nj Clayton& Js Moore
runners.comment: Ran creditably at Bath when last seen; one of the main form contenders
runners.spotlight: Similar type to Nobleman, having produced form figures of 722, and is the chief threat to that rival on ratings; likely to stay, having performed creditably over a testing 1m2f at Bath when last seen.

stable_tour.quote: He's very nice and one to keep an eye on over a mile. He goes really well and the sire's had a couple of winners. He's topped a couple of the breeze-up sales and they've been very well received. 04-07-24

runners.name: My Mate Arnie
runners.comment: Debutant by Ardad out of a 6f winner; market helpful
runners.spotlight: Debutant by Ardad out of a 6f-winning daughter of an unraced close relative of Derby runner-up Walk In The Park; market helpful.

runners.name: Praying For Time
runners.owner: Tactful Finance, S Roden & T Solway
runners.comment: Gosden filly who seemed to need her debut run; likely to do better
runners.spotlight: Easy to back in Chelmsford event (1m2f) and ran accordingly, shaping as if the outing/experience was needed; looks the type to do better, being a Gosden-trained daughter of Sea The Stars.

6:00.race_name: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Born Slippy
runners.comment: Out of a Group 3 sprint winner; stable does well in 2yo AW races
runners.spotlight: £55,000 yearling; ninth foal; half-brother to five winners including Al Messila (1m; RPR 87), Muatadel (5f-7.4f including AW; 86), Cashla Bay (7f 2yo; 82) and Fard (6f including AW; 72); dam 5f/6f winner (including 2yo/Group 3; 109); stable has very good strike-rate in 2yo AW races (20% over last five seasons).

runners.name: Davvy
runners.comment: Out of a very useful sprinter but others look more interesting all the same
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to Qatar 6f/7f winner Espirito; dam 5f/6f winner (including 2yo; RPR 111); already gelded; others look a bit more interesting on paper.

runners.name: Kesta
runners.comment: 5,000gns yearling; pedigree suggests he'll be better suited by longer trips
runners.spotlight: 5,000gns yearling; first foal; dam placed 7f (including 2yo/AW; RPR 68), half-sister to winners Redolent (1m Listed), Qatar Dance (useful 1m-1m2f) and Pepita (7f Listed); already gelded; pedigree suggests he'll be better suited by longer trips.

runners.name: Tamather
runners.comment: £10,000 yearling; out of a Listed-placed 7f winner; well worth a glance in the betting
runners.spotlight: £10,000 yearling; seventh foal; half-brother to 5f-7f winner Tawaazon (including AW; RPR 99); dam Listed-placed 7f winner (including 2yo; 104), closely related to 7f/1m winner Bawaasil; well worth a glance in the betting.

runners.name: Could Be The Move
runners.comment: Bred to want further than 5f but trainer tends to do well with early-season 2yos
runners.spotlight: £40,000 yearling; 11th foal; half-sister to six winners including Ghaamer (7f-1m including AW/UAE Listed; RPR 111), Kalaatah (1m4f AW; 97) and Jazaalah (US 1m/1m1f turf); dam 1m winner (96), half-sister to 7f 2yo Group 3 winner Bint Shadayid, out of 1,000 Guineas winner; bred to want further than 5f but trainer tends to do well with early-season 2yos.

runners.name: Rajdad
runners.comment: Out of a very useful 5f-7f winner; picked up for 2,000gns as a yearling
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 5f-7f winner (including AW; RPR 105), half-sister to UAE 2,000 Guineas winner Gold Town; picked up for 2,000gns as a yearling; considered only if lively in the betting.

runners.name: Hollywood Treasure
runners.comment: Sister to Listed-placed 6f 2yo winner Fairy Dust; no surprise if she poses a threat
runners.spotlight: 32,000gns yearling; fourth foal; sister to Listed-placed 6f 2yo winner Fairy Dust (RPR 93); dam placed 7f AW (70), half-sister to Listed-placed 5f/6f winner Ballymore Castle; no surprise if she poses a threat.

8:30.race_name: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap

runners.name: Flatley
runners.comment: Won for the fourth time here a fortnight ago and still favourably treated; drawn widest
runners.spotlight: All four AW wins have come here, the latest on his return from ten weeks off with cheekpieces reapplied over this trip a fortnight ago; still well treated on previous form despite a 3lb rise, but he has the outside stall.

runners.name: Local Bay
runners.comment: 6lb below last winning mark but out of form since last autumn
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f winner around here who scored four times on turf last year; 6lb below his last winning mark, but his performances since the autumn leave something to be desired; stable also runs Poetic Force.

quotes.race: Spreadex Sports £300 Spread Betting Cashback Handicap
quotes.quote: After Local Bay's win last week the only thing we had in the back of our minds was the bounce factor, backing him up too quickly. He's one of those horses that needs that early gallop to drop his head and get into a rhythm - Jack Mitchell, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Poetic Force

prev_owners.owner: S Barton & Exors of the Late W McLuskey

runners.comment: Has won five times over C&D, but losing run now up to 21; look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has won five times over C&D, but losing run now up to 21; look elsewhere.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Claiming Stakes
quotes.quote: Tony (Carroll) thought Poetic Force would need the run after such a long layoff so fair play to him. They didn't go any pace which helped. David Probert - Jockey

quotes.race: 32Red Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: We have not had Poetic Force that long and I am still learning about him in some ways. He has done that well and is the type we will keep going on the grass when the spring comes - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Middle Distance Handicap
quotes.quote: I've ridden Poetic Force at home and he has a nice turn of foot. They didn't go mad and I thought it played into our hands - George Downing, jockey.

quotes.race: 32Red.com Claiming Stakes
quotes.quote: Poetic Force went up 9lb for winning which we thought was a bit harsh so we dropped him to a claimer. This is his trip and he'll get further - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: 32RedSport.com Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Poetic Force had a good draw and was very straightforward.  The race worked out nicely just having a tow off the leaders.  Adam's horse picked up but my lad always had it covered - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

runners.name: First Greyed
runners.comment: Unexposed on AW and respected in hat-trick bid from 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Only made his AW debut in January, but has made up for lost time by winning twice last month with a visor reapplied, firstly over C&D (66-1) and then under a 4lb penalty at Southwell (1m, Tapeta); respected in his hat-trick bid from 3lb higher.

runners.name: Cerulean Summer
runners.comment: Dual 9.5f winner here; this trip may be an inadequate test for her now
runners.spotlight: Both wins came over 9.5f here during the autumn and she has been running consistently well in defeat from similar marks in recent months; this trip may be an inadequate test for her now.

runners.name: Venetian
runners.comment: Landed a bit of a touch here last time and now 7lb higher; market again revealing
runners.spotlight: Two of his three wins have come here, ending a 19-race losing run when landing a bit of a touch (9.5f) 18 days ago; up 7lb but the market may again prove most revealing.

runners.name: I Cant Believe
runners.comment: Running well on Tapeta in recent months, including a win over C&D in January; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Improved once a visor was applied and has been running well on Tapeta in recent months, including a win over C&D in January; blinkers are now given a go and he would have to make the shortlist if they have a similar effect.

runners.name: Visibility
runners.owner: Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam
runners.comment: Six course wins, two over this trip, but has only won two of his last 37 starts
runners.spotlight: Six course wins, two over this trip; has only won two of his last 37 starts, though, and likely to find a few too strong again; stable also runs Light Up Our Stars.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Handicap
quotes.quote: We always knew Visibility had a lot of ability, he can be a bit hard to catch right but everything worked out well today. I never doubted he'd be as effective on turf - Scott Dixon, trainer

runners.name: Forever Proud
runners.comment: Four wins on the AW during the winter, two of them over C&D; back off last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Four wins on the AW during the winter, two of them over C&D; shaped as though the return to this trip would suit when third of ten at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) last time (winner has gone again twice since); now back off her last winning mark and high on list.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Forever Proud doesn't do an awful lot when she hits the front but if something rallied I always thought she'd go again. It was a very different scenario tonight, she's been running over an extended mile at Wolverhampton - that suits her very well - and I had slight reservations about 7f round here, but she's in such a good vein of form at the moment and all credit to James [Owen, trainer] and the team, they'e got her spot on - Hector Crouch, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's been very busy. She won at Chelmsford on December 19, then was second at Wolverhampton a couple of days later and then we ran her again at Wolverhampton on December 27 before the handicapper put her up and she won again. She's always shown her best form at Lingfield and it took me a while to work out how to train her really, but we've tweaked a few things and got to the bottom of that. We're looking forward to getting her back to Lingfield in January and I think her form will step up again when she gets back there. 01-01-25

runners.name: Light Up Our Stars
runners.owner: Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam

prev_owners.owner: Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam
Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam

runners.comment: Three wins here, two over this trip, but has only one win in his last 30 starts
runners.spotlight: Three wins here, two over this trip; only one win in his last 30 starts, though, and didn't look a winner waiting to happen when fifth of seven off this mark at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) on Friday.

quotes.race: BJ Llewellyn Supports Tenovus Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Light Up Our Stars ran a grand race at Newbury on his seasonal comeback on very soft ground and the quick conditions here have helped him. We will have to see how the handicapper looks at the result before making a little plan - Richard Hughes, trainer.

runners.name: Mariner

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Marriott
Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Respectable form over 8.5f here of late, winning once and placed twice
runners.spotlight: Respectable form over 8.5f at Wolverhampton in February/March, winning once (maiden previously) and placed twice; major contender provided he's as effective back down in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He had his first run for us over hurdles at Musselburgh last week and did okay, finishing fourth. He'll go back on the Flat now and is probably very well handicapped. He's the type who'll be winning at the back end of January in a 0-65 over a mile at Wolverhampton. 05-12-24

runners.name: Ever Driven
runners.comment: Lightly raced; showed promise over C&D on AW/seasonal debut; interesting
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced; had wind surgery prior to showing some promise in C&D event on AW/seasonal debut; may progress with that outing under his belt and tongue-tie now added; interesting.

runners.name: Berkshire Phantom
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock

prev_owners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub

runners.comment: Met trouble last time; triple C&D scorer who remains on a handy mark
runners.spotlight: Better than bare result (met traffic issues) at Southwell last time; three-time C&D scorer who remains on a handy mark and has possibilities provided this race pans out well.

runners.name: Aljezur
runners.comment: Maiden who is well treated on peak efforts; second run for new yard
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but is favourably handicapped on peak efforts (6f/7f) and this drop back in distance is a plus on second start for new trainer, who also runs Mariner; could go well.

runners.name: Split Elevens
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Productive and consistent since last July, winning six times; solid

quotes.race: Wexford Welcomes Racing TV Members Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Coole Arcade was very good. Stepping back to 2m suited him. He was good and slick the whole way in his jumping and having something to aim at helped a lot - Rachael Blackmore, rider.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Facebook Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were always hoping he would be able to do that. Cool Arcade has been knocking on the door once or twice. It's really good for Pimlico Racing (owners) as they have a few horses in the yard - Rachael Blackmore, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He fell at Naas on Saturday but he's had a good year. She won two and was placed as well. He'll go on a break now and return in the spring. 14-11-22

runners.name: Dontdooddson
runners.breeder: M Goulven, Mlle Celine, M Pierre-Yves Berthouloux & Mme Fa
runners.owner: Profit In Your Pocket Racing Club
runners.comment: Last win was in 2021, weak hurdles form this season, no better in a chase on latest
runners.spotlight: Veteran's last win was in 2021; weak hurdles form this season; no better in a handicap chase at Thurles on latest.

6:45.race_name: Limerick Races On Facebook Handicap Chase
6:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watering)

runners.name: Drumgill
runners.comment: Three-time hurdles winner, won on chase debut, set stiff task last time, could  feature
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdles winner; successful on good ground at Thurles in November on chase debut; next run was over hurdles; faced a tough task when a well-beaten third of four finishers at Thurles last month; should hold his own in handicaps.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Drumgill went disappointing over hurdles but probably got sick of it. Philip Donovan rode him the last day and wasn't too hard on him and we freshened him up since. He is a brilliant jumper, loved that good ground and we thought he'd run okay - John Ryan, trainer.

runners.name: Mount Frisco
runners.comment: Course winner over hurdles, 1-13 over fences, often placed but pulled up on latest
runners.spotlight: Course winner over hurdles; 1-13 over fences, that win coming in a Tramore novice early last year; placed in a Listed handicap chases at Gowran and Fairyhouse around this time last year; fell in a valuable handicap at Listowel last September; pulled up at Navan ten days ago on first run after a winter break.

runners.name: Willywampus
runners.comment: Won twice over fences in the first half of last season, needs to recapture his best form
runners.spotlight: Won twice over fences in the first half of last season; ended the campaign with a poor run at Tramore; failed to take advantage of his much lower hurdles mark in two outings at Thurles in November; big price when a remote seventh on his return to chasing last month.

runners.name: General Clermont
runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De Clermont
runners.comment: C&D win last May; won again at Wexford in August, possibly a bit high in the ratings now
runners.spotlight: Hard to win with over hurdles (1-29, placed eight times); better record over fences, 2-11, including a C&D win on good-to-yielding last May; won again at Wexford in August; possibly a bit high in the ratings now judged on his final two 2024 outings.

runners.name: American Money
runners.comment: Good hurdles form recently, poor handicap chase run in January represents a black mark
runners.spotlight: Solid placed form over hurdles at Naas on last two starts; runs off 9lb lower than his hurdles mark but has a question mark against him on account of a poor showing at Naas in January in his first handicap chase;

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: American Money is what he is but he's a good solid horse. He'll probably go chasing at some stage. He's qualified for the final of this series at Punchestown, so that's where we'll target him - Eddie Harty, co-trainer

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Download The Mobile App" Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: American Money is a nice horse but we have no great plans for him. We'll have to look at the next division up now and he's a nice fun horse. He'll make a nice chaser in time and he will improve - Eddie Harty, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Dont Talk
runners.comment: Up an aggregate 15lb for two wins in January, every chance that he can maintain progress
runners.spotlight: Followed up a 2m4f win at Down Royal in January with a 2m1f success at Fairyhouse four days later; up an aggregate 15lb but every chance that he can maintain progress; form of his Fairyhouse win was boosted by runner-up Champagne Mahler at Gowran.

quotes.race: SBK Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Don't Talk jumped and travelled well and the soft ground seemed to bring out a bit of improvement in him - Karl Thornton, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote+ Pays You More At Tote.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Don't Talk brought me to the front soon enough but I had to go when I did. Hopefully there is a bit more in him, he was just doing the bare minimum in front - Danny Gilligan, rider

runners.name: Battle Of Ridgeway
runners.comment: Well beaten in fifth in a chase since a 2m Gowran handicap win off his lower hurdles mark
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m Gowran handicap off his lower hurdles mark on his penultimate start; beaten 20l in fifth when reverting to chasing at Navan ten days ago.

quotes.race: HPR Fleet Management Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Battle Of Ridgeway looked the winner here the last day coming to the second-last the last day over fences. He just didn't get home after running with the choke out but he was way more relaxed today stepping back in trip. He's a real chaser but was always a moral to win a race over hurdles off his (12lb lower) mark. The boys wanted a runner today and it was the only suitable race so it's pot luck he's run over hurdles. We'll probably go back over fences as he's a natural chaser - Martin Hassett, trainer.

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Battle Of Ridgeway surprised me. I thought he would need the run. We've always liked him. He'll go back over hurdles. he#s well handicapped over hurdles - Martin Hassett, trainer

quotes.race: Camida The Source Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Battle Of Ridgeway has just been immature. It's hard to do it first time in a handicap and maybe he is going to be the horse we thought he was - Martin Hassett, trainer

runners.name: Itsalonglongroad
runners.comment: Versatile veteran had a slump in form after recording his fourth chase win last autumn
runners.spotlight: Versatile veteran had a slump in form after recording his fourth chase win (tenth win in all) at Ballinrobe last September; others preferred.

quotes.race: Pickardstown Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The visor worked a treat today. Itsalonglongroad is an older horse and that is exactly what he needed. The lad who rode him the other day with a visor on said he ran away with him and I thought if he does that over 2 miles he mightn't get home but to be fair to him he jumped like a buck and kept going - Shane O'Callaghan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Littleton Handicap
quotes.quote: We knew Itsalonglongroad had the ability to do it but he needed to show it on the day. Dylan (Browne McMonagle) gave him a super ride. At Listowel he overreached at the third-last and Shane (O'Callaghan) made a good decision to pull him up and wait for another day. He'll go to Killarney on Monday for another handicap - Patrick O'Leary, owner.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Itsalonglongroad was very good. He's not an easy horse to settle so the fact that he jumped so well meant we could make use of it. I got an easy time in front and he galloped all the way to the line - Mark Bolger, rider

quotes.race: Brennan's Pharmacy Tramore Handicap
quotes.quote: The track suits him and the early pace also helped him to settle, as did the absence of stalls. The ground is probably a shade on the easy side now which he seemed to really enjoy. Ross Coakley, winning jockey on ITSALONGLONGROAD

quotes.race: Tote Proud Sponsors Of Ballinrobe Racecourse Maiden
quotes.quote: Itsalonglongroad deserved that. His main problem is that he is hard on himself. We've been trying to drop him in and it hasn't worked, but he got a good ride from Ross and he kept at it well. I think the hold-up tactics will be abandoned for now - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Bulmers Cider Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was the plan to make all. He raced very free in Down Royal, and he has been a keen horse at home. We said we'd put the hood on him today and make the running, thankfully it has worked out - Mark Bolger, rider

runners.name: Carlas Big Jim
runners.comment: Encouraging second behind a front-runner in a six-runner contest over C&D last time
runners.spotlight: Won two handicap hurdles last season in testing conditions; unplaced on his first three handicap chase runs, though Clonmel fifth in February was satisfactory; ran second throughout behind the front-running Coming Up Easy in a six-runner contest over C&D last time.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back On Every Race At Cheltenham Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Carlas Big Jim probably got an easy lead, but he acts well on that ground. Cal knows him very well and he says he jumps better when he's up there. We might run him next in a qualifier for the Full Circle Series at Cork - Louis Archdeacon, trainer.

7:15.race_name: Private Suites @ Limerick INH Flat Race
7:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watering)

runners.name: Casafierna

runners.name: Comanche Magic
runners.comment: Long odds all three starts, best effort a 13.5l seventh of 17 latest, more needed
runners.spotlight: Long odds and failed to trouble the judge in three starts; best effort a 13.5l seventh of 17 at Clonmel (2m3f, heavy) latest; needs more.

runners.name: Dani Donadoni
runners.comment: Order Of St George gelding, related to bumper winner, yard won this last year, big chance
runners.spotlight: Order Of St George gelding, cost 29,000euros as a foal; fourth foal; half-brother to winners Beat The Bat (useful bumper/2m3f hurdle) and Rae Des Champs (2m-3m2f hurdle); dam unraced sister to 2m hurdle winner Blackjack Boy, out of half-sister to high-class 2m-3m hurdle/chase winner Back In Front; top yard won this last year; obvious chance on paper.

runners.name: Ifonlyshedlisten
runners.comment: Failed to complete in two point-to-points, son of Policy Maker can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete in two point-to-points; son of Policy Maker can only be watched on Rules' debut.

runners.name: Khmer
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Tonnencourt
runners.comment: Ran well at Leopardstown in December, step up in trip and good ground may suit, claims
runners.spotlight: Best effort in three starts a 1.25l second of 11 at Leopardstown's Christmas meeting; beaten 21l on latest when fourth at Fairyhouse (2m, soft); may improve for this new trip and better ground; considered.

runners.name: Moorish Castle
runners.comment: Casamento gelding, dam a bumper winner, worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; Casamento gelding is a second foal; dam bumper/2m6f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners So Fine (useful 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase), Davids Jewel (2m hurdle) and Tens Or Better (bumper); worth a market check on debut.

runners.comment: Triple figure odds last six runs and well beaten, pulled up over hurdles latest, discount
runners.spotlight: 0-6 in bumpers; triple figure odds last six starts and hasn't looked like landing a blow; pulled up over hurdles latest; discounted.

runners.name: Panjandrum

runners.comment: Point winner over 2m4f, bought for 95,000GBP, half-brother to bumper winner, respected
runners.spotlight: Won a point-to-point at Chaddesley Corbett (2m4f, soft) for Gina Andrews in December; bought by current connections for 95,000GBP at the Cheltenham sales in January; half-brother to a bumper winner and respected on Rules' debut for top yard.

runners.name: Powerful Paddy
runners.comment: Good effort on debut, didn't build on it latest upped in trip, chance if acts on ground
runners.spotlight: Ran a fine race on debut at Fairyhouse (2m yielding to soft), beaten just 2.5l into third; didn't build on that upped to 2m2f on soft at Galway latest; yet to race on good ground; place chance on that Fairyhouse run if he handles conditions.

runners.name: Red Or White
runners.comment: Arctic Cosmos gelding, yard 3-104 in bumpers last five seasons, probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Arctic Cosmos gelding is a third foal; half-brother to point winner One For Dan; dam placed 2m1f hurdle, half-sister to 5f-1m4f Flat/2m hurdle winner Salute Him and 2m-2m4f hurdle winner Paperprophet, both useful; yard 3-104 in bumpers last five seasons; probably best watched.

runners.name: The Gooses Acre
runners.comment: 80-1 for debut at Wexford and beaten 36l, son of Milan may need more time
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 80-1 on debut at Wexford and was beaten 36l; this son of Milan may need more time.

runners.comment: Beaten wide margins in all three starts, hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Beaten by wide margins in all three starts, including in a first-time tongue tie (retained) at Naas on latest; hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Shake The Bag
runners.comment: Triple figure odds and ran accordingly in two bumpers last month; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Triple figure odds and ran accordingly in bumpers at Thurles and Cork two weeks apart last month; hard to fancy after those efforts.

runners.comment: Tailed off and pulled up on debut at Naas, tongue tie left off, others appeal more

runners.name: Scott Lang

quotes.race: Tote Guarantee On All Win Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: Scott Lang only travelled okay and got a nice lead. In behind horses, he wasn't really travelling but I just kicked him into the gap just to see what would happen and he picked up nicely. He put it to bed well - Luke McAteer, rider.

runners.name: Big Debates
runners.breeder: S A I G E P
runners.comment: Rated 32lb higher over fences, struggled last two hurdles starts, may want softer ground
runners.spotlight: 12yo is a much better chaser than hurdler and rated 32lb higher in that sphere; beaten 7.25l off 131 on his latest start here in a handicap chase over 2m7f; very tame efforts last two starts in handicap hurdles; may want softer ground than this.

quotes.race: Tim & Martin Molony Veterans Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Big Debates enjoyed himself there today. I was worried about the pace that he may end up in front, but the two JP horses went on in front which was lovely for us. It was nice and smooth today and he jumped lovely - Robert Tyner, trainer

quotes.race: Follow Limerick Racecourse On Instagram Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Big Debates met Grade 1 horses in his point-to-points but has had a lot of issues since. Every day is a bonus, we're minding him and getting there. We left him off after Ballinrobe, we'd have been afraid to run him on quicker ground even though might prefer it more than heavy ground. Hopefully if he stays right he can progress - Robert Tyner, trainer.

runners.name: The Sugarhill Lady
runners.comment: Locally trained handicap debutante, promise in a maiden here in October, monitor market
runners.spotlight: Locally trained handicap debutante; promise in a 16.5f mares' maiden here on good ground in October; pulled up on return from a break at Thurles; tongue tie worn all previous starts is left off; worth monitoring closely in the market.

runners.name: Look Dont Touch
runners.comment: 0-18 over hurdles, hasn't shaped like a winner in waiting recent starts, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Veteran remains a maiden after 31 starts under Rules; 0-18 over hurdles and hasn't been shaping like a winner in waiting on recent starts; others preferred.

runners.name: Hay Baby
runners.comment: H'cap debutante, well beaten at long odds in three maidens, watch unless money comes
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner on soft; long odds and well beaten in a trio of maidens on similar ground at 2m-2m2f; best watched on handicap debut unless the market speaks in her favour.

runners.name: Seeyouatpuck
runners.comment: Big prices and well beaten in maidens, related to a fast ground Flat winner, check market
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure odds and beaten wide margins in three maiden hurdles on testing ground at 2m-2m6f; related to a fast ground Flat winner so might improve for this surface on handicap bow; check the market.

runners.name: Chefs Kiss
runners.comment: Point winner, ran well over 2m5f here on h'cap debut, place claims off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner on heavy; ran well in a good ground bumper at Downpatrick; best hurdles effort came here on handicap debut in December over 2m5f (yielding to soft); same mark here and he has place claims.

runners.name: Bal Kauto
runners.comment: Rated 22lb higher over fences, fell on return from long layoff at Gowran, interesting
runners.spotlight: 1-13 over hurdles, the win coming over C&D off 81 in May 2023 and 11lb higher now; has proved to be a better chaser, winning both starts in that sphere and rated 114; fell four out on return from 630 day layoff at Gowran when still seemingly travelling well; interesting.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better At Downpatrick Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Bal Kauto is a lovely, sharp horse and jumps like a cat. We'll see how he comes out of it, he's in again at Wexford on Tuesday - Declan Queally, trainer.

runners.name: Voice Of Reason
runners.comment: Flat winner, 0-16 over hurdles, disappointed back on good ground at Downpatrick, oppose
runners.spotlight: Flat winner is 0-16 over hurdles; switch to good ground didn't bring about any improvement at Downpatrick on Sunday; others hold more pressing claims.

runners.name: Jekiki
runners.comment: Tongue tie reached for after disappointing stable debut after break, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles for Jesscia Harrington, best effort a 24l third of 12 in a Thurles maiden in November 2023; beaten 84l on seasonal reappearance and first run for this yard; tongue tie reached for; difficult to fancy.

runners.name: Silent Selector
runners.comment: No impact in maidens or on h'cap debut, tongue tie on, others have more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: No impact in three maiden hurdles at long odds; similar story on handicap debut at Thurles after a 103 day break early last month; tongue tie goes on; still early days but others hold more pressing claims.

runners.name: Sea The Sunset
runners.comment: Off 434 days after Downpatrick win off 86, mild promise over 2m here latest, may need soft
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark in his second handicap hurdle at Downpatrick in October 2023 off 86; off 434 days subsequently and shaped with a bit more promise on his second run back when midfield here over 2m; down 1lb and the step up in trip should suit but he may need softer ground.

runners.name: The Lucky Lobster
runners.comment: Ran well off 2lb higher on penultimate, too keen latest, hood back on, claims if settles
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; 0-14 over hurdles but has run well in defeat; sound effort when an 11l third at Punchestown (19.5f, soft) off 92 on penultimate and 2lb lower now; raced too keenly upped to 3m at Leopardstown; good ground fine; chance if he races more evenly with the hood back on and tongue tie left off.

runners.name: Newport
runners.comment: 0-6 over hurdles, stayed on well over 2m on h'cap debut, step up in trip could suit
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden is 0-6 over timber; promise on handicap debut when staying on nicely over 2m at Thurles off 90 and 1lb lower now; not as good at Naas since but that may have come too soon; been freshened up and could go well upped in trip.

runners.name: Lacken Forest
runners.comment: Well-beaten in maidens at long odds; midfield on handicap bow, may need more time.
runners.spotlight: Well-beaten in maidens at long odds; midfield on handicap bow at Thurles in hood and tongue tie combo (retained); may need more time.

runners.name: Nobody
runners.comment: Handicap debutant, hopes pinned on good ground sparking improvement, watch
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden; triple-figure odds for four maiden hurdle starts on testing ground and not much to take from them; hopes pinned on switch to handicaps and good ground sparking improvement; best watched.

runners.spotlight: Not much promise in three maiden hurdles at 16.5f to 19.5f on heavy-good; pulled up on handicap debut on return from 261 day break at Punchestown in February; down 3lb but a leap of faith required; cheekpieces on.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Vase (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour was just a little bit keen early and Tom [Marquand] was keen to get him to settle, so he was well back. He has run a hell of a race on ground faster than he really likes, so you've got to be thrilled - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

quotes.race: Grand Prix de Saint-Cloud (Group 1) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: The two Group 1s in Australia were fantastic but to win a Group 1 in Europe was important. Dubai Honour seemed to really enjoy himself today and looked to be travelling well all the way. The ground was probably a bit quick for him but maybe the trip [1m4f] on this ground is more suitable. He seemed to stay the trip really well which gives us another option. On the faster ground he gets this trip really well. William [Haggas] will decide where he goes but he's in lots of Group 1s all over the place. He's just a star of a horse and every time he gives his all. He's so good in his mind - assistant trainer Maureen Haggas.

quotes.race: Grand Prix de Chantilly (Group 2) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour got rushed over ten furlongs in Hong Kong where there's a short run to the first bend. Now he's shown he can go a mile and a half we might look at going back to Hong Kong for the Vase, a race in which they have the whole straight before the turn - Philip Robinson, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Magnolia Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour was a bit fresh and I think the run will have done him the world of good. He's such a grand horse, a sweet one, and that was good. It's nice to get his head back in front. He won a Group 1 only a year ago, but when you do those foreign trips, it takes time to get them back in the groove again. He needs to go after the money and is a slow-ground horse, but did win on faster last year. I think the plan is a Group 1 in Hong Kong on April 28 - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Longines Queen Elizabeth Stakes (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour relaxed very well, and I knew when he relaxed well, he would pick up and he picked up well. Anamoe is a great horse, take nothing away from him, but this horse has come forward for being here and he's won well. I think Tom was keen to track Anamoe. The horse was prominent in the Ranvet which is not normally his style of running. He likes to come off the pace - William Haggas, trainer, speaking to Racing.com.

quotes.race: Ranvet Stakes (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was very much worried about the track, but they assured me it was on the five side of a good four and Chris Waller told me it was fantastic, so we decided to gamble and run, and that was a great result. Dubai Honour had a great year in 2021 but he wasn't quite himself last year. However, he had a very, very good winter and I've been really happy with him - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Cup (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour ran a really good race and he was just a bit unfortunate with how the race unfolded, which often happens there. When he got out and hit his stride he really came home well. This trip will have taught him a lot and hopefully we'll have a smart international performer on our hands next year - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco Champion Stakes (British Champions Middle Distance) (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour ran a fantastic race. The draw didn't help and then he got a bit set alight. He came from quite a way back with a winning chance but the French horse was just too strong. We might now have a dart at Hong Kong - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour did that well off a gallop which was a bit stop start. He's going the right way and toughed it out - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Dubai Honour has probably been a bit of a slow learner and he did well to finish second at Chester, which is a tight track. He's improving all the time and is a nice horse for the future - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

runners.name: Vauban
runners.breeder: P Decouz & S C E A Du Bas Bugey
runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock, Ab Vauban Et Al

quotes.race: Lexus Melbourne Cup (Group 1 Handicap) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We're disappointed again. Vauban looked like a picture in the mounting yard and was ready to rock. William said from halfway he was flat out and I think we did well to finish eleventh. For whatever reason he just doesn't seem to travel down here well and we're puzzled. Maybe we should stay here, I don't know. I'll talk to Willie and we'll have to figure out what to do as I'm not sure what we can do in Europe with him - Rich Ricci, owner alongside wife Susannah.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Hamilton Lonsdale Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Two miles on the Flat is his optimum trip. Vauban got there so easily and I ended up getting there too soon. He was idling but he did enough. He's a class horse - William Buick, rider. The plan must be to go to Melbourne now. We said we'd work back from it and I don't know what we do next - he is in the Irish St Leger - but Australia remains the plan. He was very, very good today - Rich Ricci, joint-owner.

quotes.race: Gold Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I think we got plan A working very well; Colin got Vauban in a nice position settled on the rails. Everything opened up for him nicely and it looked like he didn't stay against that calibre of animal. Kyprios is probably special and in a lesser two-and-a-half-mile race he'd probably have his chance. I think we're going back. I was happy enough with that run to go back to Melbourne. It's a half-mile shorter and he goes on the ground. When you have a horse who goes on that ground, you take your chance. He'll have at least one run before, maybe two - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Yorkshire Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I was delighted, they'll be very happy with that. Vauban is going to get further and he felt he was going to improve for that so there are plenty of positives to take from it - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Lexus Melbourne Cup (Group 1 Handicap) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Vauban was beaten too far out for my liking. When I saw him coming to the six-furlong marker and Ryan had to give him a squeeze, I thought 'that's not great'. He should have been cantering at that stage. He just flattened out and ran very disappointingly. He didn't fire on the day. Maybe it was the heat - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballyroan Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I wasn't worried about the drop in trip for Vauban as he'd won a Listed event in France a couple of years ago over a mile and a half and, although further suits him better, we were confident enough it wouldn't pose a problem. Colin (Keane) said it was straightforward. They went a nice even gallop, which suited him and a little bit of juice in the ground suited him well and he picked up well in the straight. He had to run in the first three today to tick that box to pass the ballot for the Melbourne Cup, so he's done that now. Willie will decide in the next few weeks what he's going to do with him - David Casey, trainer's assistant, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Copper Horse Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't expect to be in front, but I got Vauban out okay and nobody else wanted to be in front. They told me he stays very well and I felt I had to keep building the pace. He got into a good rhythm and stretched all the way to the line. He's a very smart horse. He won a Listed race on the Flat in France and he was in a handicap here and he's done what he's done jumping. I'd say today was a bit of a shock to him making the running, but he got the job done very well - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Ballymore Champion Four Year Old Hurdle (Juvenile) (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Vauban is able to get down and hurdle properly now. He settled well and was able to change gear. He looks hugely exciting - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Hurdle (Juvenile) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'll have a word with Rich (Ricci), but I imagine what we'll do is hurdle this first season then give them the summer off, hurdle next season and then go Flat racing after that and I'd love to win the Melbourne Cup, but that might be in 2023. Punchestown could be next - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV "12 Euros Per Month This Weekend Only" Spring Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Vauban had a very good run at Punchestown. Paul got his jumping together and he has improved. That puts him in the Triumph picture. He put it all together today - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It's very hard for five-year-olds in their second season to compete with the older horses, so I'm hoping he'll be the finished article next season 14-2-23

He was the top juvenile hurdler last season, winning the Triumph and two other Grade 1s. The following season is always a tough one for five-year-olds and he has run with real credit in his two runs behind State Man. He's in the Champion Hurdle and will run well, but I'd hope next season, when he's the finished article, he'll be a serious contender for top honours. 08-03-23

runners.name: Arapaho
runners.owner: Bjorn Baker Racing, C E Holt Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.name: Duke De Sessa
runners.owner: M J Regan, S E C Duke Et Al

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance on Duke De Sessa's first time over a mile and a half - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Eyrefield Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Duke De Sessa is a lovely colt for next year, he is still immature. There is lots to look forward to. Hopefully he can come back early next season for a Guineas trial and I see him as a horse for next year's Irish 2,000 Guineas - Dermot Weld, trainer.

runners.name: Zarir
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C

quotes.race: Prix Ganay (Group 1) (4yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Zarir has confirmed he's as good as we thought. He's shown he's competitive at this level and we know he stays further. I think, with his turn of foot, he'll be even better on quicker ground - Francis Graffard, trainer.

runners.name: Circle Of Fire
runners.owner: M Johnston, Mrs A J Johnston Et Al

prev_owners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen

quotes.race: Newmarket Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Circle Of Fire has run very nicely for only his third start and as you could see, he looks as though he will go up another gear if he goes another two furlongs. Ryan (Moore) thought they went slightly too steady for him early on and thought that had they gone a bit quicker it might have suited him all the better - John Warren, racing manager to HM The King and HM The Queen Consort.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Circle Of Fire is big and impressive physically and for his size and scope Sir Michael has been seeing something at home. He had a nice introduction, partly because he wasn't so quick out of the stalls when he started. The penny dropped, he got into gear and Ryan was impressed. He's a nice horse for the future, he looks as though he's got exciting potential - John Warren, racing manager to The Queen.

stable_tour.quote: He is very progressive and following a gelding operation he came out at Newcastle last month and won with ease by five and a half lengths off his opening mark of 76. The handicapper raised him 11lb on the back of that impressive effort, which I can understand. Even after the gelding operation he still seemed very gormless at Newcastle until Danny [Muscutt] grabbed hold of him. He will progress with racing experience and there is more to come from him. 29-03-23

runners.name: Asterix
runners.owner: D Kelt, M J Greatbatch Et Al

prev_owners.owner: D Kelt, B Kelt Et Al

quotes.race: BetVictor Geoffrey Freer Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I think 16-1 for the St Leger is fair. There's a bit of time between now and then and I think that's the plan for Zechariah. We'll discuss it with everyone, but Dad and I are never shy of having a pop. He was disappointing at Newmarket, but I think we ran him back too quickly after his good run at Ascot. He won the Haynes, Hanson and Clark on good to soft, so goes on most ground - I just don't think he wants extremes. He's also in the Caulfield Cup and Melbourne Cup and he's got Australian connections so we'll talk to them with regard to that - Freddie Meade, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Martin Densham Memorial EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zechariah is a nice horse and when he gets stronger he's going to keep improving. He'll stay further and will improve for going up to a mile. Martyn Meade's system works and he finds a good horse every year. He could well be the next one - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Waltham
runners.owner: Mcs Racing, M J Burns Et Al

prev_owners.owner: MCS Racing Syndicate, M J Burns Et Al

quotes.race: Hipodromo De La Zarzuela Rated Race
quotes.quote: Waltham is just a nice horse. I thought he had to be a stakes horse to do that and I'd say he's a stakes horse on that ground. You're not going to see the best of him until this time next year when he grows up - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Vintage Voyager Maiden
quotes.quote: Waltham is a horse we have always loved. We knew he would be green and we also knew he was only 70 to 80% cooked. We'll take baby steps. We would have been very disappointed today if he didn't do that - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Warmonger
runners.owner: Oti Racing, Balmerino Racing Partnership Et Al

runners.name: Kinesiology
runners.owner: A Kheir, N A Greenhalgh Et Al

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Vinnie Roe Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Kinesiology had a good look in front and as far as I'm concerned he was definitely the best horse on the day. The stewards made their decision and they are in charge. There was a bump close to the line, but I felt my horse had the race in safe keeping at that stage. He quickened up past Declan's mount and was just dossing in front. The best horse won but it was taken away from him - Shane Foley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed nicely to finish second at Leopardstown and has done very well since. He won't be appearing until the ground dries out. I'd say he could definitely stretch out to a mile and a quarter. 24-04-24

runners.name: La Crique
runners.owner: Mrs J K Cassin & J T Cassin

quotes.race: Qatar Lillie Langtry Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: I think they go quicker in three-mile chases, don't they? River Of Stars ran a sound race and I'm really pleased with her. She's a tough filly. We'll probably go for the Park Hill now - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: Pontefract Castle Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: River Of Stars is very tough and she stays well. It was a good opportunity for her. I'm glad she held on. She kept finding. The second horse came very late but she kept finding all the way to the line. I wasn't sure she had held on but I was hoping. She deserved that - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Bronte Cup Fillies' Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It played out well. If it wasn't River of Stars's first run of the year I'd have let her roll along. I had to sit into everyone at the top of the straight as she was a bit lairy, but she knew where the line was and stuck it out well. I wouldn't be surprised if she gets further too. Ralph's been aiming her at this and it's worked out lovely. She had a lot to turn around - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She's consistent and I'm sure something will fall her way again this year. She won the Bronte Cup at York last season and that is the obvious race for her in May. She likes the track and also ran well in last season's Lonsdale Cup. She'll need to improve again to step up in grade, which is possible given she's from a late-developing family. She's training well and is versatile. 15-04-24

runners.name: Lekvarte

runners.name: Honey Girl
runners.owner: T N Porter, Mrs B E Porter Et Al

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Circus Maximus Irish EBF Athasi Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Honey Girl had some very smart form last year, she won very well here last time and she looks an exciting filly for the future. She handles soft ground well and she is probably at her best on this surface so that is something we can keep in mind for the rest of the season. I thought she was impressive today. She was awkward at times last year and was tricky in the stalls, but Dylan gets on well with her and it's nice to see her back up a good run with an even better one - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

stable_tour.quote: I think she has come on a bit since she won her maiden at the Curragh, and she did well to win that day. She had a couple of very good runs last year at the top level. 06-04-23

This lovely filly joined us from Henry de Bromhead this season and I was delighted when she won on her debut for us in a 7f Curragh maiden on very soft ground last month. I would love to get a stakes win on the board and she will go back to the Kildare course for the Group 3 7f Athasi Stakes next month. 12-04-23

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Cooley Fillies & Mares Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Sakti has got the black type in the bag every race she has run. She is a stalwart, but it is just brilliant to get the number one on her back. From day one, she has been promising to do that and I'm just delighted that she has done it - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer
